Novie dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy various items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Belgica Conzuelo

texts.es:
Belgica tiene 60 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con dos hijos que aun son solteros pero en total tiene seis hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  

Belgina trabaja en la agricultura en la siembra maiz, arroz, cacao y a la crianza de pollos y cerdos para incrementar la economía de la familia. 

El cultivo que más sobresale es el maíz, los productos los vende en el mercado de Ventanas.

El socio solicita el crédito para la agricultura, compra de urea, semillas, fertilizantes y una bomba para utilizar los insecticidas y  balanceados de engorde y crianza de pollos y cerdos

El sueño es mejorar lka produccion para tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Belgica is 60 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and with two children who are still single, but in total she has six children. She lives in the canton of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios.

She is a member of the solidarity group "10th of September," which is located in Lechugalito, a precinct that belongs to the Ventanas canton and the province of Los Rios.

Belgica works in agriculture. She plants corn, rice, and cacao and raises chickens and pigs to augment the family economy.

The crop that is most important is corn. She sells her products in the market in Ventanas.

She is applying for the loan for her farming work. She will buy urea, seeds, fertilizers, and a pump to use for insecticides, as well as balanced feed to fatten and raise chickens and pigs.

Her dream is to improve her production in order to have more income.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, fertilizers, and a pump to use for insecticides.

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 46-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children.

Her husband is a turner by profession. He works with a lathe machine; he manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motor cars, and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles and  renews the turbine and radiators. He has been doing this business for many years and until this time his business has been very settled. 

Due to continuously working on the lathe machine,  some important parts have torn off which urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement of the affected parts,  it highly affects the whole mechanism of  the lathe machine.

Her husband is a poor person; he does not have a sufficient amount of money to buy spare parts to fix the problems of the lathe machine. Also he could buy cutting tools. 

Therefore, she requested a loan for her husband so he can buy spare parts for his lathe machine. Shehnaz hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for a lathe machine, tools, and cutting tools to work with the lathe machine.

loans.name: Jyldyzkan

texts.ru: Жылдызкан 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Жылдызкан - средне-специальное образование, она работает воспитателем в детском саду. Жылдызкан очень любит детей, поэтому и своих детей у нее 4- 3 сына и 1 дочь. Супруг занимается хозяйством, определенной работы нет. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Жылдызкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 11 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жылдызкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жылдызкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жылдызкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Jyldyzkan is 41 years old, married, and with her husband is raising four children. Jyldyzkan has a specialized secondary education. She works as an educator in a kindergarten. Jyldyzkan likes children very much, and of course her own children: three sons and a daughter. Her husband is engaged in farming, not a specific job. As an additional source of income for her family, Jyldyzkan raises livestock, having begun 11 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Jyldyzkan currently has on her homestead: one dairy cow, one steer, and 10 sheep. Monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her farm, Jyldyzkan turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy cows to increase her livestock count.

Jyldyzkan plans to invest income from the loan to further propagation of the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for the further education of her children.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Buen Progreso Group

texts.es: Blanca es una de las tres socias del grupo tiene 38 años de edad, soltera, con cinco hijos, su negocio  es la compra y venta de cosechas en el mercado de Masaya desde hace  9 años, tiene a tres personas que le ayudan a en el proceso de corte. Es cliente de la institución desde hace 3 años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosechas de tamarindo. Olga tiene la edad de 60 años su negocio es el destace de cerdo en pie, Miriam tiene 53 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Blanca, a member of the trio pictured above, is 38 years old and is a single mother of five children. For the past 9 years, she has worked selling fresh produce in the market in Masaya, and she has three people who help her with the logistics of getting her produce to market. 

With the support from this loan, Blanca plans to purchase tamarind fruit for resale at her business. She has been a member of the community bank for three years. Olga, another group member who is 60 years old, works as a pig butcher. Miriam, 53 years old, is the final member of the trio and makes a living selling cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase tamarind fruit for her business.

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.en:
Zaynura, 25, is a hard-working married woman and has four children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Zaynura does not have a higher education, but has always wanted to get a degree.

She has some land where she grows crops, but her income from growing crops is small. She is going to organize a new business in animal husbandry. With this aim, she completed and earned her certificate in the ‘To Get Ahead’ program at a women’s organization.

Zaynura is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Husniya

texts.ru: Хусния очень трудолюбивая и целеустремлённая женщина. Она родилась в сельской местности, и имеет достаточный опыт по животноводству и выращивания сельхоз культур. Детство Хуснии прошла очень тяжело. Ее отец был больным, а мама не имела постоянной место работы. Самых ранних лет она  работала на поле. После окончания школы она поступила в Медицинский колледж. Повзрослев, она вышла замуж. Данное время она имеет 3 детей. Ее муж занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Хусния тоже хотела организовать свой бизнес и найти источника дохода. Шесть месяцев назад она начала свой бизнес животноводством. Хусния запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки скота для расширения оборотного капитала нового бизнеса. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Husniya is a very hardworking and determined woman. She was born in the countryside, and has sufficient experience raising livestock and growing crops. Husniya's childhood was very challenging. Her father was ill, and her mother did not have enough work.

From her earliest years, she worked in the fields. After high school, she enrolled in the College of Medicine. Growing up, she got married. Currently, she has three children. Her husband grows crops. Husniya also wanted to start her own business and find a source of income. Six months ago, she started her business raising livestock.

Husniya is requesting a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy livestock to expand the working capital of a new business.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing the working capital of her new business

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Soutoura est un regroupement de femmes de Sogomougou qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les tissus, Soumbala, Savon, Légume, Condiments, Poisson, Couture et autres. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe. 
Fatim est un membre du groupe Soutoura assise dans le rang de devant et en 2 eme position de la droite vers la gauche.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des chargements de charrettes en bananes yoyo, en légumes et d’autres fruits au fur et à mesure elle vend.  Elle s’approvisionne à Koutiala en grande quantité et les vend en détail au comptant à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Soutoura comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 144 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Fatim compte réaliser  160 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Soutoura is a group of women from Sogomougou who know each other well and who live in big traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They are 33 years old on average, married, and have at least three children. 

This group of women sell items such as cloth, soumbala (a local condiment), soap, vegetables, condiments, fish, and do sewing, etc. In order to grow their businesses, the members decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their seventh group loan.

 Fatim is a member of Soutoura group and is sitting in the first row, second person right to left. She intends to use her loan to buy wagonloads of yoyo bananas, vegetables and other fruits according to her sales. She buys her goods in Koutiala in bulk and sells them retail and for cash out of her home and at the market to a diverse clientele. 

Whereas the other members of the Soutoura group expect to make an average profit of 144,000 F CFA each during this loan period, Mme Fatim hopes to make 160,000 F CFA. Besides reimbursing the loan, the group members will use part of the income to cover personal expenses and grow their working capital.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Yiriwa est un regroupement de  femmes de Koutiala quartier Hamdallaye qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans, sont mariées et au ont moins 2 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes de Koutiala fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, de condiments, Jus,  Sucre, Soumbala et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur douzième prêt de groupe. 
Haby 1ère assise de la droite vers la gauche, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de Soumbala. Elle se procure de ces Soumbala  à Koutiala et les vend au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Yiriwa comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 180 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Haby compte réaliser  220 000FCFA.   
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter leur fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Yiriwa is a group of women from the Hamdallaye neighbourhood of Koutiala.  They live in large, traditional families with their husbands, children and extended families.  They are all around thirty-three years old, married and have an average of two children.  The women of the group buy and sell various items, such as food ingredients, juice, sugar, soumbala (ground, cooked seeds or beans), etc.

In order to increase the size of their businesses, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their twelfth group loan.

Haby (sitting on the right of the picture) will use her loan to buy soumbala.  She buys her supplies of soumbala in Koutiala, and sells them for cash, from her home and at the market, to a diverse clientele.

The other members of the group expect to earn a monthly average of 180,000 francs CFA, but Haby expects to earn 220,000 francs CFA.

The women will use their earnings to repay their loans, provide for the expenses of their families and increase their working capital.

loans.use: to buy soumbala for resale.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    DJIGUISSEME est constitué de  4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3ème prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de   produits de beauté à l’image de KADIATOU qui est la femme assise   dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, diversses quantités de pommades  avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme Group is made up of four married women, around the age of thirty-five, they each have four children.  They live in nuclear families in the Heremakono Nord region of the town of Bougouni.  The women know one another through friendship, business and neighbourhood ties.

In order to improve their financial status and become more efficient with their businesses, the group works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their third loan with the field partner.  The previous two loans have been fully and correctly repaid.

The women buy and sell beauty products.  Kadiatou (sitting in the photo) will use her loan to buy skin cream from wholesalers in Bougouni.  She sells her products from her home and at the market, on a cash or credit basis, to a wide range of customers.

Kadiatou expects to earn a monthly average of 20,000 francs CFA, and she will use her earnings to reinvest in her business and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy skin cream for resale.

loans.name: Aisalkyn

texts.ru: Айсалкын 51 год, замужем, вместе с мужем воспитывают 4 детей. У Айсалкын - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айсалкын занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айсалкын, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айсалкын обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Айсалкын планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Aisalkyn is 51 years old, married, and with her husband is raising four children. Aisalkyn has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Aisalkyn raises livestock, having begun 18 years ago with a livestock purchase of 5,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Aisalkyn currently has on her homestead: four dairy cows, two horses, and 15 sheep. Monthly income amounts to 11,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Aisalkyn turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy steers for fattening and subsequent sale in the market at a premium.

Aisalkyn plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of the quantity of domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Ella es Alejandra, desde pequeña el sueño es ser artista, a pesar de no tener los medios necesarios quiere cumplir con el sueño, ella ha tenido que vivir junto con la familia en diferentes pueblos y muy humildemente, ya que en tiempo pasado no tenían los medios para pagar un arriendo, aun así sobrevivieron y ahora viven mejor, ella nunca cambio la mentalidad de ser una gran artista superando cualquier dificultad, la vida para ella es una difícil tarea que esta dispuesta a asumir con la fuerza que nace del  alma y con las ganas de ser ejemplo para los hermanos menores que emprenden esta vida y cumplen con los más grandes anhelos.  
Gracias al apoyo que ha recibido por parte de Kiva, ha logrado terminar el segundo semestre en el cual aprendió técnicas y evoluciono la manera de dibujar, ha logrado también obtener las pinturas y papeles que se requieren en esta carrera, aportando a los dotes un concepto de publicidad el cual ha mejorado también con el vocabulario y el desarrollo de ideas, el cual a futuro le ayudara a obtener mejores oportunidades de manera laboral, de igual manera también ha logrado mantenerse al día y así lograr seguir adquiriendo los conocimientos de los profesores y compañeros, hoy se va  formando tanto profesional como humanamente, y agradece la colaboración al igual que espera terminar los estudios con méritos y cumplir el sueño de ser una artista. Va por buen camino y con anhelos de seguir adquiriendo nuevos métodos y conocimiento. 
Cuando la gran preocupación de continuar en los estudios estaba en no obtener la economía suficiente para obtener lo de los materiales, gracias a KIVA siente el alivio de preocuparse por ser la mejor académica mente y la mayor alegría es saber que existen entidades las cuales ayudan a cumplir los sueños de las personas que difícilmente pueden seguir con los estudios solos.
Gracias por la atención y colaboración dirigida.
texts.en:
This is Alejandra whose dream from a young age is to be an artist. Despite not having the means to do so, she wants to make her dream a reality. She has had to live with her family in different towns and in a very humble manner, as in the past they didn't have the funds to pay the rent. Even so, they survived and now they live better. Alejandra never changed her mind about becoming a great artist and overcoming any difficulty whatsoever. For her, life is a difficult undertaking that she is ready to take on with the force born from her spirit and the desire to be an example for her younger siblings who are setting out in this life and want to achieve their greatest desires.

Thanks to the support that she has received from Kiva, she has managed to finish her second semester in which she learnt techniques and improved in her manner of drawing. She was also able to obtain the paint and paper that are needed for this course, adding a concept of advertising to her skills which has also helped with the vocabulary and development of ideas that, in the future, will help her obtain better work opportunities. Similarly, she has also managed to keep up-to-date and therein continue gaining knowledge from the professors and fellow classmates, today, she is developing on both a professional and a personal level and she is grateful for the contributions. Likewise, she hopes to finish her studies with good grades and realize her dream of becoming an artist. She is on the right track and dreams of continuing to acquire new methods and skills. 

When her greatest worry about continuing her studies was not having enough money to obtain the course materials, it was thanks to Kiva that she felt the weight lifted off her so that she could concentrate on being the best academically speaking and it is a real joy to know that there are organizations which help make the dreams of those people who would have difficulty in continuing to study alone a reality.

Many thanks for your attention and collaboration.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of schooling.

loans.name: Erika Noemi

texts.es:
Erika Noemí tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en Morropon, una comunidad que guarda mucha tradición, también se le conoce como la capital del Tondero, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, venta de cerveza y bebidas, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio desde hace dos años por lo que cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
30-year-old Erika Noemi lives with her husband and children in Morropon, in the Piura region on Peru's north coast.  The community upholds many of its traditions and is also known as the capital of the Tondero dance.  The inhabitants work in agriculture, trade and cattle rearing.
Erika has sold groceries, beer and soft drinks for two years.  Having hershop in her own home means that she has a steady clientele.  She has applied for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to stock her shop and thereby generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to stock her shop.

loans.name: Segunda Lucero

texts.es:
Segunda Lucero tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, frutales y arroz, comercio de los mismos y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica al comercio y crianza de animales menores gallinas y patos, las compras lo realiza en los caseríos aledaños para posteriormente ofrecerlos en los restaurants de la zona, su esposo se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su propia mototaxi, así como a construcción civil.

Segunda Lucera ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
33-year-old Segunda Lucero lives with her husband and children in Pucará district.  The community is known for its warm climate and lies 2 hours away from the city of Jaén, which is in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern sierra.  The inhabitants work in agriculture, growing coffee, fruit and rice in particular.
Segunda breeds and sells small animals such as hens and ducks.  She buys them in neighbouring villages and later offers them for sale to local restaurants.  Her husband runs a transport service in his own motortaxi, as well as doing some building work.

Segunda Lucero has applied for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy small animals which she will then fatten up and sell to her customers.  This will enable her to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy animals to sell.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: La señora Maura, es una mujer soltera que se dedica a su labor por completo, vendiendo ropa de segunda en su casa de habitación, también cuenta con el apoyo de su familia que le ayudan a vender en la Costa Caribe, por lo que está muy contenta porque así mueve la mercadería adquirida, sus hijos son independientes, dos de ellos habitan con ella, así juntos se apoyan en los gastos del hogar. Doña maura solicita el apoyo de crédito para invertir en su pequeño negocio para comprar variedades de pacas de ropa para ofrecer a su clientela.
texts.en:
Maura is a single woman who is completely dedicated to her job, which is selling second hand clothing in her house. She also has the support of her family who help her to sell along the Caribbean coast. For this reason she is very happy because she turns around her stock. Her children are now independent; two of them live with her, and so help each other with the household bills. 

Maura is requesting the aid of a loan in order to invest in her small business and buy various bales of clothing to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy various bales of clothing.

loans.name: Grupo Triunfador Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Grupo Triunfador, está conformada por once integrantes, madres solteras con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser responsables, trabajadores, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron cursar una carrera y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Rosalpina y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergentes, huevos, crema, hielo, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The “Grupo Triunfador” (Triumphant Group) communal bank has eleven members; single mothers with 20 children under their care. They are originally from Sauce, located in the northern area of the country. They are known for being responsible, hard working and with a strong drive towards personal development.  Unfortunately, because of lack of economic resources they couldn’t go to school. They felt obligated from a very young age to help with household expenses.

Thanks to their efforts and desire to come out ahead, the coordinator is Rosalpina. She has a ‘pulpería’, a small store that sells food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, eggs, cream, ice, juices, fizzy drinks... She spends 12 hours daily at her business selling her products. Her business is located in her house. The aim for the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business in the buying and selling of food products, so that in the near future she can gain a better income.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her convenient store with food products like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergents, eggs, cream, ice, juices, fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Los Geranios De Mollepata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS GERANIOS DE MOLLEPATA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Mollepata, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Mercedes  ella es casada, tiene 59 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de restaurante turístico, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende diferentes tipos de platos como sopas,arroz con pollo ,saltados, platos a la carta entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir  apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como arroz,aceite entre otros para su negocio.

La socia que salen en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de celulares, agricultura, tienda de abarrotes, restaurante, tienda escolar, turismo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "THE GERANIUMS OF MOLLEPATA". This bank is located in the district of Mollepata, which belongs to the province of Anta and department of Cusco.

Mercedes, one of the members, is 59 years old, married and has two children. She combines her daily activities with her tourist restaurant business. She has been carrying out this business for quite some time and it is going well thanks to her constant effort. This member sells different types of dishes such as soups, chicken and rice, saltados [typical Peruvian dishes] and other dishes her customers ask for. This member hopes to be able to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family.

Mercedes is requesting a loan in order to buy food supplies such as rice, and oil, among other items, for her business.

The member who appears added into the photo asked for permission to arrive late due to work commitments.

The other members make a living selling mobile phones, farming, running a grocery store, restaurant, school shop and in tourism.

This member is grateful to those who form part of making her dream come true through this loan and she is committed to paying her loan payments promptly.

loans.use: to buy food supplies such as rice and oil, among other things.

loans.name: Shodikul

texts.ru: Шодикул родился в сельской местности. С раннего детства Шодикул помогал отцу по выращиванию сельхоз культур и скотоводству. Шодикул единственный сын в семье. Он женат и имеет одного сына. Шодикул обратился в нашу организацию во второй раз за займом в размере 2000 сомони. По словам Шодикула за полученный  займ, он собирается использовать на покупку корма для скота, т. к. Шодикул пасёт крупный рогатый скот-быка, который будет готов к продаже через месяц. Шодикул говорит, что сейчас продажа быка не имеет пользы. Введению бизнеса ему помогают его отец, мать и жена. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shodikul was born in the countryside. From early childhood, Shodikul helped his father in growing crops and shepherding. Shodikul is the only son in the family. He is married and has one son.

Shodikul turned to IMON for the second time, for a loan of 2,000 somoni. In Shodikul's words, he intends to use the loan received to buy feed for cattle, and the like. Shodikul tends to bulls, which will be ready for sale in a month. Shodikul says that that selling a bull now is of no avail. In running the the business, he is helped by his father, mother, and wife.

loans.use: to buy feed for cattle

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan vive en la ciudad de Chincha y trabaja como docente en un centro educativo de su ciudad, lleva laborando desde hace 6 años y el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque tiene mucha paciencia para enseñar.

Juan gracias al apoyo de los prestamistas kiva podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder mejorar las paredes de la vivienda donde habita, asimismo colocara un piso de cemento, entre otros, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Juan lives in the city of Chincha and works as a teacher at an education center there. With six years teaching experience, he believes things are going well professionally because he has lots of patience in the classroom with his students.

With the support from this loan, Juan plans to purchase construction materials to reinforce the walls of his home, as well as put in a cement floor and make other improvements to his living space. He is grateful for this opportunity to improve his quality of life and continue working towards his dream of having his own business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Maredsa

texts.en:
Maredsa, a 37-year-old married mother of four, works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store in the Philippines for five years, and earns additional income from food vending. 

Having received and repaid one previous loan from NWTF, Maredsa has requested a new one for PHP 5000 to purchase additional goods such as coffee, milk, cereals, cooking oil, sanitary napkins, canned goods, etc. to sell. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods such as coffee, milk, cereals, cooking oil, sanitary napkins, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Fredah's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 4 group leader farmers in Kakamega North District with Fredah selected as the Kiva representative. Fredah has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 49 other individual farmers in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of KSH 5349 shillings.							

Fredah is a reliable member of the community. She is married with 3 children. Fredah is 30 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 2 years to support her family. In addition to this, Fredah is very active in her community and is involved in the women's group. She described her harvest last year as good. She hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success she is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.							

The 2013 long rains season won’t be Fredah’s first season with One Acre Fund.  She first joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, and get new farming methods, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds. As an active member in her community, Fredah also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader, and is an active community member, and wants to help more farmers, and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Fredah plans on using future profits from the harvest to send children to school and invest in a business. Her life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because she has more farm training and is able to feed the family.			

Fredah and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Marta de 46 años , es la propietaria de un taller de costuras que inició hace 10 años, cuando capitalizó la experiencia en confecciones, que traía desde niña, apoyada por una amiga suya, quien la contactó con un almacén de ropa infantil, del cual generó ahorros, los cuales invirtió en su negocio.  En la actualidad sus principales productos, son la ropa para niños y niñas, los cuales elabora en su taller, mediante las operaciones de diseño, preparación, ensamble y acabado de piezas y vende a crédito, comprando las materias primas de contado, en grandes proveedores de telas y especializados, en insumos para la confección. Su meta mas adelante es ampliar su taller, mejorando cualitativamente los acabados de la producción y con ello vender más, ganar más y aumentar su calidad de vida. Esta es la razón, por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  una máquina fileteadora, e insumos para confección, como telas, hilos y accesorios, para complementar un acabado a la medida de las fiestas navideñas, que se acercan y que impulsan sus ventas y mas aun, teniendo una oferta de mayor calidad, con esta inversión.
texts.en:
Marta is 46 years old and has been the owner of a sewing shop she started 10 years ago, when she leveraged the experience she had in making clothing, from when she was a child.  She got help from a friend with a children’s clothing store who contacted her.  This generated income that she invested into her business.  Currently her main products are boys’ and girls’ clothing, which she designs, prepares, makes, and finishes in her shop and sells on credit.  She buys her supplies in cash from large fabric suppliers who specialize in clothes making supplies.  Her future goals are to expand her workshop, improve her items, and increase her sales to generate more income and improve her quality of life.

This is the reason that she requested a Kiva loan, her first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the money to buy a sewing machine and supplies, such as fabrics, thread, and accessories to complete her items for the approaching Christmas season.  Her sales increase during this season and she wants to be able to offer more to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and supplies.

loans.name: Sulukhan

texts.ru: Сулухан 48 лет, вдова одна воспитала 2 детей, старший сын работает в столице, младший сын проживает с Сулухан и помогает по хозяйству. У Сулухан - средне-специальное образование, она окончила медицинское училище, по специальности - медсестра. После окончания училища до 2009 года работала в местной больнице. С 2009 года работает в сельской управе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Сулухан занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 17,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сулухан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 20 овец. Сулухан очень трудолюбивая, предприимчивая и целеустремленная дополнительно в основном в вечернее время шьет шторы на заказ у себя дома. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сулухан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Сулухан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Sulukhan is 48 years old, widowed, and raised two children on her own. The elder son works in the capital, and the younger resides with Sulukhan and helps around the homestead. Sulukhan has a specialized secondary education. She completed medical school, with a specialization as a nurse. After graduation through 2009, she worked in a local hospital. Since 2009, she has been working in the village council.

As a source of additional income for her family, Sulukhan raises livestock, having begun 14 years ago with a livestock purchase of 17,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Sulukhan currently has on her homestead: two dairy cows and 20 sheep.Sulukhan is very hardworking, enterprising and determined and additionally she mainly sews curts on order at night in her home. Monthly cumulative income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Sulukhan turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to buy steers to increase her livestock count.

Sulukhan plans to invest income from the loan to further propagate the quantity of domestic animals, and to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: Patricia Irene

texts.es: La señora Patricia tiene 37 años y tiene una hija de 16 años,  se dedica a la venta de artículos de limpieza como detergentes, jabones, lavavajillas, etc. así también vende víveres como sardinas enlatadas, atún, leche, etc. que se encuentran en zona Villa el Carmen, este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución, va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería de temporada al por mayor, esto debido a que por fin de año las empresas bajan la producción  de estos artículos, La señora Patricia enfrenta retos en su negocio ya que ella ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante y zona por zona,  su deseo es que quiere mejorar negocio y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida,  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando víveres y artículos de limpieza para incrementar su capital.
texts.en:
Sra. Patricia is 37 years old and has a 16-year-old daughter.  She sells cleaning products such as detergents, soaps, dishwashing liquid, and other items.  In addition, she sells food products such as canned sardines, tuna, milk, and other staples that are found in the District of Villa del Carmen.  

This loan is her first transaction with Emprender.  She will use the funds to buy seasonal merchandise since there are very few of these items produced at the end of the year.  Sra. Patricia faces challenges in her business, such as offering her products as a traveling vendor since she must go from district to district.  She wants to improve her business so that she can have a better quality of life.  Patricia will use the profits to continue buying food products and cleaning supplies in order to increase her capital.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise that is in short supply at the end of the year.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
Luis Manuel de 48 años de edad, soltero sin hijos, es originario de  Leon, lugar que está  ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar estudios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar administración de empresa. En la actualidad lucha día a día para poder mantener y hacer crecer su negocio.
Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad la venta de comida en su casa de habitación. El dedica  su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo desayunos, almuerzo y cena a estudiantes, trabajadores y público en general. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y compra productos comestibles para preparar los alimentos como arroz, carne, pollo, ensaladas, jugos, gaseosas, azúcar, aceite, salsas, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Luis  Manuel agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Luis Manuel, 48, single with no children, is from Leon, located in the western part of the country. He is known for being hard working, responsible, and with a strong drive towards personal development. Unfortunately, he wasn’t able to study but he would have liked to study Business Administration. Now, he strives daily to be able to maintain and grow his business.

Thanks to his efforts and his drive to get ahead, he sells food from his house. He spends 12 hours a day providing breakfast, lunch and dinner to students, workers and the general public. 

The aim for the loan is to invest in working capital and to purchase food to prepare the meals such as rice, beef, chicken, salads, juices, fizzy drinks, sugar, oil, salsa, so that in the near future he can earn a better income. 

Luis Manuel is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide for people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified way of earning a living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to purchase food to buy and sell such as rice, beef, chicken, salads, juices, fizzy drinks, sugar, oil, salsa.

loans.name: Walter Jenrry

texts.es:
Walter Jenrry tiene 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se caracteriza por ser hospitalaria, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicios como obrero en construcción civil como encofrados, columnas, pisos, entre otros, el se dedica a esta labor desde hace cuatro años en su distrito y alrededores, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos para la compra de herramientas de trabajo que le permitirán mejorar el servicio, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Walter Jenrry is 56 years old, he lives together with his wife in the district of Oyotún, a community which is characterized for its hospitality. Its inhabitants make their living in farming, commerce and livestock, it is a district located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

Walter Jenrry makes his living offering services as a worker in civil construction such as planks, columns, flooring and so on. He has been making his living in this field for four years in this district and in its environment. He has a considerable customer base, and has sought a loan of 4,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to buy work tools which will allow him to improve his service, generating a larger income for his family.

loans.use: to buy civil construction tools.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es:
Ella es Johanna y quiere estudiar para tener un mejor futuro para los hijos, Johanna quiere aprender por que le gusta servir, cuidar…En fin, son  tantas las cosas por las que johanna a pasado, entre ellas, dificultades y necesidades que ahora  no quiere que los hijos la vivan, johanna ve en el estudio una oportunidad de sacar los hijos adelante y hacer de ellos y de el futuro un mejor mañana.

Estudiar enfermería es un sueño que ella siempre había tenido y con la ayuda de kiva ella lo puede hacer realidad , no solo ella se sentiría realizada, si no que los hijos harían parte de la felicidad de haber cumplido ese hermoso sueño

Muchas gracias por ser parte de ese sueño para johanna
texts.en:
This is Johanna. She wants to study in order to have a better future for her children. Johanna wants to learn because she likes to serve and take care of people. Many things have happened to Johanna in the past, among them, difficulties and needs that she doesn’t want her children to experience. Johanna sees that in studying, there’s an opportunity to get her children ahead and to have a better future for them.

Studying Nursing is a dream she has always had and with the support of Kiva, she will be able to make it come true. Not only would she feel the accomplishment but her children would be a part of this happiness of having completed this wonderful dream.

Thank you very much for being a part of Johanna’s dream.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of schooling.

loans.name: Akmurad

texts.ru: Акмурад 38-летний фермер, проживает в районе Джиликуль. Он занимается растениеводством и животноводством в течение 22 лет. Дополнительно он еще предоставляет услуги мастера по ремонту дома. Он трудолюбивый человек и всегда усердно работает, чтобы обеспечивать семью. У него жена, двое дочерей и двое сыновей. Детям по 5, 8, 10, 12 лет. Жена помогает ему в ведении сельского хозяйства. Акмурад в данный момент поглощен посевом пшеницы. Он просит кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений и семян пшеницы. Весной он надеется собрать хороший урожай и за счет полученной прибыли провести торжество по случаю обрезания своего младшего сына.
texts.en:
Akmurad is a 38-year-old farm, residing in the Jilikul region. He has been growing crops and tending livestock over the course of 22 years. Additionally, he offers home repair services. He is a hardworking person and always diligently works in order to support his family. He has a wife, two daughters and two sons. The children are ages five, eight, ten, and twelve. His wife helps him in conducting the agricultural work.

Akmurad is currently absorbed with planting the wheat. He is requesting a loan to acquire mineral fertilizers and wheat seeds. In the spring, he hopes to collect a good harvest and from the profits to hold a celebration on the occasion of his younger son's circumcision.

loans.use: to acquire mineral fertilizers and wheat seeds, and with the profits to hold a celebration on the occasion of his younger son's circumcision

loans.name: Star Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    STAR est constitué de  7 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de31 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  FARABA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  fruits  à l’image de  ALIMA qui est la 2ème femme debout  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10régimes de bananes avec les transporteurs  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Star Group is made up of seven, married women, around the age of thirty-one, each with three children.  They live in traditional, extended families in the Faraba district of the town of Bougouni.  

The women know one another through friendship, business and neighbourhood ties.  In order to improve their financial status and the efficiency of their businesses, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their first loan with the field partner.

The women buy and sell fruit.  Alima (standing second from the left in the photo) will use her loan to buy 10 bunches of bananas from transporters from Bougouni.

Alima expects to earn a monthly average of 20,000 francs CFA, which she will reinvest in her business and use to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy fruit for resale.

loans.name: Magaly Del Socorro

texts.es: Magaly es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, de 32 años de edad. Casada y madre de tres hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Negocio que inicio hace cuatro años con dinero ahorrado, poco a poco iba comprando sus productos, luego opto por un crédito para ir adquiriendo más productos. Hoy en día cuenta con una pulpería bien diversificada. Su meta próxima es comprar una refrigeradora para ofrecer productos que necesitan refrigeración. Solicita el crédito para comprar: gaseosa, arroz, jabón, golosinas, pan, aceite, entre otros con de diversificar su mercadería y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le ayudara ya que incrementara sus ventas y obtendrá mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es seguir adelante son su negocio y ofrecerle un futuro garantizado a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Magaly is 32 years old and is married with three children. She is from the city of Estelí and makes a living running a convenience store. Starting with a small amount of savings four years ago, Magaly began buying a few products at a time and gradually building her business. She later applied for and received a loan to help with her business endeavor, and her next goal is to save up money to purchase a refrigerator so she can significantly broaden the variety of goods she offers to her customers.

With the support from this loan, Magaly plans to purchase merchandise to stock her store, including: soft drinks, rice, candy, bread, oil, soap and other products. She hopes this investment will help her to keep up with increasing client demand, strengthen her business and increase sales and overall profits. Her future plans are to continue with her business and do all she can to provide a bright future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase: soft drinks, rice, candy, bread, oil, soap and other products to stock her convenience store.

loans.name: Percy Abarham

texts.es:
Percy vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, trabaja en su pequeño negocio de decoración y shows infantiles desde hace 3 años; con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro Percy ha ido mejorando poco a poco en su negocio y el cree que le va bien porque es muy amable y sobre todo cumplido con los clientes.

Percy gracias al apoyo de los prestamistas kiva podrá comprar materiales para su negocio, como tecnopor, globos al por mayor, entre otros, con lo cual podrá mejorar la atención a sus clientes y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Percy lives in the city of Pucallpa and works at the party and decor store he started three years ago. With lots of hard work, dedication and saving, Percy has been able to gradually grow his business. He believes business is going well in part because he always treats his clients with kindness and respect and always completes customer orders on time.

With the support from this loan, Percy plans to purchase merchandise to stock his business, such as balloons, styrofoam and other products for completing client orders. He is grateful for this opportunity, as it helps him to pursue his dream of one day owning his own house.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock his business.

loans.name: Kipkoech

texts.en: Meet Kipkoech. He is a farmer who lives in Kericho with his wife and one child. He has been a farmer for three years; he sells milk and tea from his farm. Even though he says that farming is very expensive, especially for a young farmer like him, he really enjoys it. Kipkoech chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they help farmers by providing the necessary training that will enable them to grow economically. This loan will help him purchase a chaff cutter, which will give his dairy cows a conducive environment to produce more milk and will increase his income, giving his family better living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Sharifjon

texts.ru: Шарифчону 21 лет. Он очень трудолюбивый и целеустремленный парень. В школе он учился отлично. С детства он мечтал получить высшее образование и стать хорошим специалистом. Условия жизни у них были очень тяжелые. С самых ранних лет он помогал родителям по домохозяйству. Он окончил школу с хорошими оценками и поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса. Данное время он является студентом 4 курса. Шарифчон учится в факультете Экономика и бухгалтерия. Шарифчон должен оплатить за учебный договор, но зарплата его родителей не хватает для оплаты учебы. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы. Он очень надеется на вашу доброту!
texts.en:
Sharifjon is 21 years old. He is a very hardworking and determined fellow. In school, he was an excellent student. From childhood, he dreamed of getting a higher education and becoming a good specialist. His conditions in life have been very challenging. From his earliest years, he helped his parents around the farm. He finished school with good grades and enrolled in the Tajik State University of Politics and Business.

Currently, he is a fourth-year student. Sharifjon is studying in the department of Economics and Accounting. Sharifjon must pay tuition, but his parents' salaries are not enough to pay the tuition. He is requesting a loan to pay for his schooling.

loans.use: to pay for tuition at the university

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замире 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Старший сын находится в России на заработках, вторая дочь замужем, остальные -школьники. Супруг и дети помогают Замире по хозяйству. У Замиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Замира занимается животноводством, а точнее откормом и разведением домашнего скота, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Замиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 25 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,80 ГА, на котором выращивает хлопок, тыкву, помидоры и арбузы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Замира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Замира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на проведение свадебного торжества для сына.
texts.en:
Zamira is 51 years old, married, and with her spouse is raising four children. Her eldest son is working abroad in Russia, the second daughter is married, and the others are still in school. Her spouse and children help Zamira around the homestead. Zamira has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Zamira raises livestock, more specifically fattening and breeding domestic animals, having begun 30 years ago with a livestock purchase of 5,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Zamira currently has on her homestead: one dairy cow and 25 sheep, and also has a plot of land measuring 0.8 hectares, on which she grows cotton, squash, tomatoes and watermelons. Monthly income amounts to 16,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Zamira turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy cows for fattening and subsequent sale at the market at a premium.

Zamira plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of the quantity of domestic animals, and intends to save money to put on a wedding celebration for her son.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is a married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has eight children. Her husband works as a carpenter. Gleceria earns her income through the retail sale of gasoline. She has been in the business for several years now. 
Gleceria is asking for a loan to buy more gasoline and to pay her children's school fees. With this loan, she will be able to improve her sales and continue sending her children to school. Gleceria hopes for a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna, who is 37 years old and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, in the Philippines. She is married to Paul, a businessman, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lorna operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Lorna dreams that her business will continue to grow and expand.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is married, with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Merlyn is 45 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Merlyn has a business direct selling personal-collection products in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of personal collections to sell.

Merlyn has been in this business for three years.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of personal-collection products to sell

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe, es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia, tiene 57 años de edad, vive junto a su compañero de vida y dos hijos, su negocio consiste en la elaboración y venta de tortillas y tamales de elotes, en su negocio le ayudan  su familia, ya tiene 20 años con su negocio, lo atiende de lunas a sábado, su ventaja es que la zona donde reside no posee mucha competencia y tiene muchos clientes.
Comprara elotes, maíz, leña, aceite, ya que son parte de su materia prima. Guadalupe espera con esta inversión aumentar su producción, ofrecer productos de mejora calidad, aumentar sus ventas y seguir mejorando su economía para poder cancelar las cuotas de la deuda.
Sueña con ampliar el negocio y dar mejores condiciones familiares a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 57 years old and lives with her husband and their two children. She is a very hardworking person who has operated a business making tortillas and tamales for the past 20 years. She works Monday through Saturday with help from some of her family members, and she sells her products in the surrounding area to many clients.

With the support from this loan, Guadalupe plans to purchase corn, firewood, corn husks, oil and other items for making her tortillas and tamales. She hopes this investment will help her to increase her production and sales and allow her to offer her customers higher quality tortillas and tamales. Her dream is to grow and expand her business and to provide a bright future for her loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, oil, corn husks and other items for making her tortillas and tamales.

loans.name: Erasmus

texts.en:
Erasmas is 37 years old and married, with two children, both attending school.  He lives in Hoima, Uganda.

Erasmas deals in spare parts as his main business, but he also gets side income from farming. 

He is facing a challenge of limited capital in expanding his business.  Erasmas intends to use the loan to buy more spare parts to sell.

He hopes to buy more land to construct rentals in order to have several sources of income and educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  LAIDOU, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Djekonobougou, commune de Wacoro, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de la volaille, de condiment, du savon, des beignets, de céréales, de pain, etc.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe LAIDOU sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter les différentes marchandises citées ci-dessus.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente SETOU la première personne  debout  à droite est vendeuse de pain. Elle compte acheter 2 sacs et demi de farine pour la confection des miches de pain qu’elle vend dans le village de Djekonobougou, à Wacoro et environnants. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000 FCFA qui sera en partie utilisé dans l’achat de la farine et l’achat de chèvres comme épargnes.
texts.en:
The Laidou group, made up entirely of married women, are on average 35 years old with an average of 3 children each. All of the women live in traditional extended families in the village of Djekonobougou in the Wacoro community, located in the Dioila area of the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of Mali.) The women came to know each other through family, neighbors, and as friends.

The women are in the business of selling poultry, spices, soap, pastries, cereals, bread, etc. They are on their second group loan, which they will use to purchase the different merchandise for these businesses.

Setou is the first woman pictured standing on the right; she sells bread. She plans to purchase two and one half bags of flour for making loaves of bread which she will sell in the village of Djekonobougou, in Wacoro, and the surrounding area. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA which she will use partially to purchase flour and goats and for savings.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour

loans.name: Nuris

texts.es: En los años 2011 y 2012 un vecino del barrio, teniendo experiencia comercial, introdujo a Nuris en la venta de articulos varios, aprovechando cada temporada, enseñandole que la inversión la hiciera a la medida de la demanda de cada época. Todo esto, porque Nuris requería una fuente de ingresos, para apoyar el sostenimeinto de su hogar y una actividad independiente en la cual pudiera tambien atender sus quehaceres domésticos, era su mejor opción.  Hoy su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco, pues trabaja de lunes a domingos sin cesar, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, vendiendo mercancia a crédito, entre sus vecinos del barrio. Ella sueña con tener un almacen, donde posicionarse y vender todo lo que su clientela necesite, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente, para lograr este sueño prontamente. En la actualidad Nuris está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará juguetes y ropa para que los padres y madres de familia, adquieran a crédito, los regalos navideños y juguetes que darán a sus hijos, para  esperar unidos en familia las navidades y el año nuevo 2014, vistiendo ropa nueva, abrazados entre pitos y matracas entre musica y sonrisas hasta que el reloj les avise que ha llegado un año mas.
texts.en: In 2011 and 2012, a neighbor, having had commercial experience, introduced Nuris to the sale of merchandise, taking advantage of each season, and teaching her about seasonal demands.  All this because Nuris needed a source of income to support her household.  She works seven days a week nonstop from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm, selling merchandise to her neighbors on credit.  She dreams of having a store where she can sell everything that her customers need, but she doesn’t have enough working capital.  She is asking for a Kiva loan, her first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she can use it to buy toys and clothing.  She will grant credit to parents who buy Christmas presents so that they can be united as families on Christmas and new year, with new clothes, hugs, noisemakers, and smiles until the clock announces the arrival of a new year.

loans.use: to buy Christmas items.

loans.name: Martha Luisa

texts.es:
Martha, es una joven de 21 años de edad, vive junto a su abuela y sus hermanos, por la necesidad de aumentar ingresos que cubran las necesidades de su hogar, ella fundo una granja de pollos de engorde y gallinas ponedoras, es un oficio que le enseño su abuela y también es ella quien la apoya en el cuidado de la granja.
Con el préstamo comprara alimentos para pollos y vacunas, lo que ayudara a fortalecer su negocio, espera aumentar sus ventas en estas épocas de fin de año, mejorar sus ganancias y cancelar de manera puntual sus cuotas, para en un futuro tener la facilidad de inversión.
Sueña con tener un negocio fortalecido y ofrecer el apoyo económico a su familia para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martha is 21 years old. She lives with her grandmother and her siblings. In order to increase her income to cover the household expenses, she started a farm to raise broiler chickens and egg laying hens. It is a trade her grandmother taught her. Her grandmother also helps her take care of the farm. 

With the loan she will buy feed and vaccinations for chickens. This will help her fortify her business. She hopes to increase her sales at this time of the year, to improve her earnings and to make her payments on time so that in the future she will be able to invest easily. She dreams of having a strong business and offering her family financial support to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccinations for chickens.

loans.name: Wilmer Ulises

texts.es:
Wilmer, se decidió por otro crédito debido a que necesita pagar mano de obra y una maquina desgranadora, para la recoleccion d ela cosehca y sabe que la institución le da un buen servicio, así como también los resultados son de mucho beneficio para él.
Con el préstamo anterior compro los insumos agrícolas necesarios para aumentar su producción, tener mejores ganancias, con las cuales ha cancelado sus deudas, y cubre los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Wilmer decided to take out another loan because he needs to pay for labor costs and a destemmer machine. He needs it for the harvest and he knows that the institution provides a good service and the results are also very beneficial for him. 

With the previous loan, he bought agricultural materials necessary to increase production and have better earnings which he has used to pay off his debts and cover the family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor and a destemmer machine.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 51, married and has only one child. Her family currently lives in a rural community.

Daisy engages herself in buying and selling frozen foods to help her husband in generating income. She aims to acquire more stock of frozen foods to sell, but she has limited capital. In this regard, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy more stock of hot dogs (sausage), skinless longaniza (pork sausage), bologna, tocino (sweetened cured pork) and ham to sell.

She is hoping that her loan will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of hot dogs (sausage), skinless longaniza (pork sausage), bologna, tocino and ham to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Apolonari

texts.en:
Apolonari is a 61-year-old Ugandan male. He is married to Tumusiime and they have 4 children aged 25, 21, 19, and 17.

Apolonari is a farmer who has a banana plantation. Since 2000, he has been brewing local gin as another source of income, with the major aim to earn a living for himself and the family.

Apolonari has approached UGAFODE for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to improve the status of his banana plantation through mulching and to raise more returns to look after his family and pay school fees for his children.

His dream is to see his children achieve formal education and acquire more land for agriculture.

He is challenged by price fluctuations for his products and weather changes. He describes himself as a hardworking and honest person.

loans.use: To buy mulch for his banana plantation and pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Sofia's Group

texts.en:
Sofia is a 36-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. 

Her husband is a shoemaker and very expert in his profession. He has been manufacturing baby shoes for many years. This is the reason he has a lot of experience in his profession. He sews Rexene shoes with a machine, and after that, attaches the soles through stitching by hand. 

In this way, he is getting income for his family. Nowadays, he has gotten a huge contract, but he does not have the amount to buy raw material to complete the contract. Therefore, Sofia requested a loan for her husband so he can buy raw material such as Rexene, thread, glue, soles, etc.

Sofia is very thankful to Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy Rexene, thread, laces and soles for sewing baby shoes.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is applying for a loan of USD 600.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 21 years old amd single.

She opened her business in 2011 with her own working capital of USD 100. She is running a business in front of her house.

She will use the loan to buy rice, buckets, spoons, eggs, chicken, pork, beef, and rice. She is making good money from selling, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

She is living in a town near by the school.  Her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: To buy rice, buckets, spoons, eggs, chicken, pork, beef, and rice.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LAIDOU, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Belekonobougou, commune de Wacoro, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules,  de condiments, de savons, de l’habillement, des tubercules, de l’arachide, du poisson, des céréales, etc.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe LAIDOU sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter les différentes marchandises citées ci-dessus.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente Fatoumata  la personne  au milieu  est vendeuse d’igname. Elle compte acheter deux sacs d’igname  auprès des producteurs et effectue ses ventes en détail à une clientèle mixte à Wacoro. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 11000 FCFA qui sera en partie utilisé l’activité  et l’achat d’une chèvre comme épargne.
texts.en:
The Laidou group is comprised of married women, who have an average age of 32 and an average of four children each. They all live in large traditional families in the town of Belekonobougou, which is located in the Wacoro area of Dioila prefecture, in the region of Koulikoro (Mali's second-largest administrative region). They know each other because they are related to one another, or are neighbors or friends, and work selling tubers, seasonings, soap, clothing, peanuts, fish and cereals, among other items. The women in the Laidou group are on their third group loan, and they plan to use it to buy the various kinds of merchandise described above.                                                                                                                                                                                                 

Fatoumata is pictured in the middle of the photo, and works selling yams. She plans to purchase two bags of yams from producers, and makes her retail sales to both male and female customers in Wacoro. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 11,000 francs CFA, which she will use for her business and to buy a goat to save money.

loans.use: to buy tubers

loans.name: Chuluun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chuluun, 32 years old, lives with her husband and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as an accountant at one of the branches of the military department for nine years. Her husband transports goods, especially coal during winter, between districts for a living. 

The house her family lives in has been deteriorating over the years. So, she is requesting a loan of 4000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials, such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam, for house renovation. After the renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, and then fewer pollutants would be released into the air. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Timinadya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    TIMINADYA est constitué de  4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  DOUGOUNINA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3me prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’encens
à l’image de  DJENEBA qui est la 2eme femme debout de la droite vers la gauche  dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,diverses qualités de parfums et autres ingrédients avec les grossistes  de Bougouni pour la préparation de l’encens. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group TIMINADYA is composed of four women, all married, who average 41 years of age and four children each. The women lives in traditional extended families in the DOUGOUNINA district of Bougouni City. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity, so as to have better businesses, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third loan. The two previous ones were correctly repaid. 

This group of women does commerce in incenses, just like DJENEBA, who is the second women standing from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase diverse qualities of perfumes and more ingredients from Bougouni wholesalers for making incense. Accepting cash or credit from a mixed customer base, she makes her sales retail at the market and at home. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her business and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients for making incense

loans.name: Ambekou Group

texts.fr:
