Le groupe    AMBEKOU est constitué de  7 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 51 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 5ème prêt. Les 4 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales à l’image de FANTA qui est la 3ème femme  assise   dans la photo de la droite vers la  gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1 tonne de céréales avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group AMBEKOU is composed of seven women, all married, who average 51 years of age and six children each. The women lives in traditional extended families in the TORAKABOUGOU district of Bougouni City. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity, so as to have better businesses, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fifth loan. The four previous ones were correctly repaid. 

This group of women does commerce in grains, just like FANTA, who is the third women sitting from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase one tonne of grains from Bougouni wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit from a mixed customer base, she makes her sales retail at the market and at home. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her business and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es:
Gabino agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contento por el apoyo brindado y desea seguir participando en este proyecto pues le ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio, él continua con la venta de artefactos domésticos como por ejemplo planchas, televisores, radios y otras cosas más. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar artefactos como radios.  

Él tiene 64 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante.(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Gabino is grateful to the investors for the loan and he is happy with the support offered. He wants to keep participating in this project because he helps him increase his business' capital. He continues to sell home appliances such as irons, televisions,  radios, and more. He has belonged to the “Chacoq”  communal bank and now he needs the loan to buy appliances such as radios. 

He is 64 years old and he lives in the city of Pilcopata. He is a hardworking and enterprising person who gets ahead. The city of Pilcopata is the capital of the district of Kosñipata in the Paucartambo province in the department of Cuzco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy home appliances, e.g. radios.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат родилась в 1984 году. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Малохат занимается собственным бизнесом уже более 5 лет. Она продает продукты питания на местном рынке. Малохат продает продукты питания как печенье, шоколад, сливочное масло и т.п. Она хочет покрыть шифером точку продажи. Зимой во время снега и дождя очень трудно. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки шифера. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Malohat was born in 1984. She is not married and lives with her parents. Malohat has been running her own business for over five years. She has been selling food products at the local market. She sells such food items as cookies, chocolate, butter etc. She would like to cover the roof of her sales stand with slate. In winter, it is very hard on her when it rains or snows. She is applying for a loan in the amount of 1,500 TJS to buy slate. She is counting on your kindness

loans.use: to buy roofing slate for her sales stand.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like eggs, canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Patricia earns more income from videoke rental.

Patricia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like eggs, canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ramonita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ramonita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rugs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Ramonita is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy more rugs to sell for her buy-and-sell rugs business.

Ramonita has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more rugs to sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now.

Raquel requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell.

In the future, Raquel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a twenty-six-year-old married man with one child living in Hoima, Uganda. He is a motorcycle transporter who transports people to their destinations. 

He is charged with the responsibilities of looking after his family, being the only income-earner. His threat is the poor roads that affect his income, since he has to service the motorcycle all the time. He hopes to buy another motorcycle for transportation.

Patrick is requesting a loan to service his motorcycle.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 59 years old and married, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of five children.

Her son provides whitewash and oil paint services to his customers in the community.  Sometimes he has to go out of city, also. 

Her son has gotten a new contract for whitewashing and oil painting of a newly constructed house, but he has no paint brush or rollers for providing his services.  Shehnaz has requested a loan so that her son would be able to buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil, etc.

Her son’s savings are very poor.  That is why he is unable to buy new tools for providing whitewash services. She wants to change this condition of her family and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her son.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy paints and paint brushes for her son's whitewash services.

loans.name: Claudia Melissa

texts.es:
Claudia vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia y al lado de su esposo se esfuerzan mucho para poder salir adelante, sobre todo porque son padres de una pequeña a la cual quieren mucho y es su motor para vivir, es por ello que luego de mucho esfuerzo y ahorro lograron iniciar su negocio de elaboración y venta de churros y es la única fuente de ingresos que tienen para sobrevivir.

Claudia esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le ha  brindado ella podrá comprar insumos para la elaboración de sus churros y podrá dar un mantenimiento a su máquina para elaborar churros; de esta manera podrá mejorar su negocio y poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hija.
texts.en:
Claudia lives in the city of Aguaytia with her husband and they work hard to get by. She and her husband are parents to a small girl and they love her more than anything - she is their reason to live.  After a lot of hard work and saving, she was able to start a business of making and selling churros.  It is her only source of income and the only way for her to survive.

Claudia is thankful to the Kiva lenders and thanks to the help they have given her, she will be able to buy ingredients for making churros and she will be able to make repairs to the churros machine.  She will be able to improve her business and make her biggest dream come true - to pass along a profession to her daughter.

loans.use: to buy supplies and to make repairs to the churros machine.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida, a 46-year-old resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Fresco and they have children. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. At this time, she is working hard to sustain their financial expenses.

Zenaida is a coconut vendor. Most coconuts in the Philippines are sold by street vendors pushing wooden carts. The coconuts are served two different ways: either one end of it is cut and a straw is put in it to serve as the container itself or coconuts can be offered with the juice and the edible part of the coconut put into a plastic container with a straw. Regular customers are those who are thirsty and those who want to refresh themselves from the heat of the sun. They earn a minimum of 300 Php per day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 18,000 Php loan. She will use the loan to buy tires for the cart, wood, coconuts, and a cooling container. 
	
Zenaida hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tires for the cart, wood, coconuts, and a cooling container.

loans.name: Manolito

texts.en: Manolito is 39 years old, married and has four children. He operates and owns a rice farming business. With his aim to have a better way of life, he is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides that will be used to prepare and improve his rice field. He knows that through this loan he could earn a better income, have a plentiful harvest and increase his sales as well as be able to improve his family’s economic situation and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his rice farming business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 53-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rebecca has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Rebecca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 61 years old and has a live-in partner with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Remedios runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, eggs, canned goods, sanitary napkins, etc. 

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Remedios would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ritchie

texts.en:
Ritchie is 34 years old and a married woman with four children; three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ritchie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ritchie requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to resell to her customers. Ritchie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ritchie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick, aged forty years, lives in Hoima, Uganda. His business is reselling secondhand shoes to people around town. Looking at the status of his family, he decided to start up this business. However, he is challenged by limited capital for expansion and high taxes by the taxing authorities. His dream is to transform his business into a renown boutique in Hoima, dealing in both clothes and shoes.

Patrick is asking for a loan to buy secondhand shoes to resell.

loans.use: to buy secondhand shoes to resell.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en: Domingas is taking a loan of 1,000 USD to improve her business. She is married, and she is running a business that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy and resell scrap materials. She opened her business a year ago with her own working capital of 200 USD. She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to  buy and resell scrap materials.

loans.name: Nika

texts.en:
Nika is 21 years old, from Kutaisi district. He lives alone and is provided with a GEL 350 per month orphan pension from the government. 

Nika is unemployed and has decided to start his own business. All of the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and his lack of experience. 

After several unsuccessful attempts, Nika applied for the credit to LLC Micro Finance Organization Credo. His request was approved in the framework of a start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.  

A loan of USD 1,200 will help Nika to purchase a second-hand car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and he will transport them inter-city. 

Nika is a very enthusiastic and hard-working person with a great desire to progress in life. He is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Rubylen

texts.en:
Rubylen is 33 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Rubylen works very hard to provide for them.

Rubylen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to resell in her general store. Rubylen has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as seasonings, cereals, shampoo, detergent soap, noodles, bread, etc.

In the future, Rubylen would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome, who is married and has had a general store business in the Philippines for two years now, works hard to support her family. She has requested a PHP 9500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell.

Salome would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia, who is married, works hard to support her family through the dried fish vending business she has been operating for three years in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Virgilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es: María Esmeralda, es una humilde señora que labora como operaria de maquina en una zona franca, junto a su esposo quien le apoya económicamente procrearon dos hijos los que están estudiando la escuela secundaria y la universidad. El crédito solicitado es para división de cuartos y mejorar el piso de su vivienda, para gozar de buenas condiciones en su hogar junto a su familia.
texts.en: María Esmeralda is a humble woman who is a machine operator in a Free Trade Zone, along with her husband, who helps her out financially. They have two children who are studying in high school and at university. The loan being asked for will be used to create rooms and to improve the flooring of their home, so they can enjoy better living conditions at home with their family.

loans.use: purchase plycem, sand, rockface and cement.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem, a 55-year-old hard-working lady, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, 5 sons, and 4 daughters. Her husband is an auto mechanic; his income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Shameem is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. 

She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will expand her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Shameem has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses, and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. 

She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her family a peaceful life.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Las Profes  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las Profes está formado por 7 amigas quienes se apoyan mutuamente en algunas circunstancias o en problemas del diario vivir, son persona amables y gentiles que mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca ciudad que tiene mucha belleza natural, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta bañada por 4 ríos y es una ciudad cuna de poetas y deportistas.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ana, está realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras, espera fortalecer su amistad con todas y cumplir sus objetivos.
La Señora Ana tiene 24 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido un niño de 4 años que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña Ana se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, pero por el momento también está estudiando medicina en la universidad.
El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de ropa para venderles a sus compañeras de la universidad y así iniciar con su propio negocio. Su meta es culminar sus estudios y llegar a ser una muy buena profesional.
texts.en:
The loan group Las Profes (the teachers) is made up of 7 friends who all help each other in hard times and in daily problems. They are friendly and kind individuals who maintain the culture and traditions of their people. They live in the city of Cuenca, a city with natural beauty that was named a Human Patrimony Site in December 1999. It is crossed by four rivers and is a city that houses poets and athletes. 
One of the members of this group is Ana. She is asking for her first loan with her group of friends. She hopes to strengthen her friendship with them all and to meet her goals. 
Ana is 24 years old, married, and has a 4 year old child who attends school in the city. Her husband works for a private employer. They do not have their own home and so they  rent. 
Ana does all the housework, but right now she is also studying medicine at the university. 
The money from the loan will be used to purchase clothing to sell to her classmates and, in this way, to begin her own home business. Her goal is to finish her studies and to become a successful professional.

loans.use: purchase clothing.

loans.name: Jeannett Leonor

texts.es: La señora Jannett vende artículos para el hogar y la cocina, tiene un negocio exitoso y muy elegante, debido a que comercializa artículos finos para hogar, ademas juegos de ollas, calderas y sartenes de cubierta de teflón, siendo muy buscados y apreciados por sus clientes, el negocio se caracteriza por la venta a crédito y también por ventas que son de pedidos exclusivos. Lleva con esta actividad más de 8 años, y en este tiempo gano mucha experiencia y clientes fieles. Es madre de 2 niñas y por motivos de trabajo su esposo tuvo que irse al interior, por lo que ella se tiene que hacer cargo tanto de su negocio como de su casa. Actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de mercadería (artículos para el hogar, cocina y otros productos) de esta forma podrá incrementar sus ventas, y lograra proporcionarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Jannett sells items for the home and kitchen. She has a successful business and she is very elegant because she sells fine items for the home, as well as sets of pots and pans, large pots, and teflon pans, because these products are highly sought after and appreciated by her customers. One of the characteristics of her business is the fact that she sells on credit and also by special order. She has been running her business for 8 years and she has gained a lot of experienced as well as loyal customers. She is the mother of two children and her husband had to move to the interior for work related reasons and so she has to run her business as well as take care of her home. She is currently asking for a loan to purchase more merchandise (items for the home, the kitchen and other products). With these items she will be able to increase her sales and to be able to give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: purchase merchandise (items for the home, kitchen and other products).

loans.name: Tuvshintugs

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuvshintugs, 46 years old, lives with her husband, daughter, and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She began teaching mathematics at a high school in January, 2013. Her husband has been selling beauty products since 2007; her son goes to high school, while her daughter attends kindergarten. 

Before becoming teacher, she herself ran her beauty products sales and is still involved in it. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to buy beauty products such as shampoo, gel, and hair color in large amounts.

As a result, she and her husband will run their business without worrying about an inventory shortage. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy beauty products in large amounts

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
This is Anabelle, 32, a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Jopy, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Anabelle operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 22,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Anabelle hopes that her business will continue growing, and dreams of giving her children a good life and education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Nyamsuren, 25 years old, lives with her parents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling casual clothes at a trade center since 2011. Her father has the position of Senior Geologist at a private firm. Her mother has retired from work and gets a state pension.

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future. She is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam for their house renovation. After the renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and thus less pollutants released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Angelo

texts.pt:
Ângelo, solteiro e não tem filhos, vive na casa dos pais e e não sustenta a ninguém. 
É comerciante há mais de dez anos e os seus parentes apoiam na actividade comercial.
Com o presente empréstimo de 20.000,00mt pretende adquirir peixe carapau, frangos, farinha de milho e de trigo, ovos, açúcar e outros produtos alimentares para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonhos aumentar sua produtividade no negócio e praticar a agricultura numa área da família. Tem como principal desafio a falta de fundos para investir nas suas aspirações.
texts.en:
Ângelo is single, doesn't have any children, lives with his parents and doesn't support anyone else.

He's been a trader for more than ten years and his relatives help him with his commercial activities.

With this loan of 20,000.00 meticals (MZN) he plans to buy mackerel, chicken, corn and wheat flours, eggs, sugar and other food products so that he can respond to demand and reinforce his stock.

He dreams of increasing his business' productivity and of taking up agriculture on some family land. His main challenge is the lack of funds to invest in his aspirations.

loans.use: buy mackerel, chicken, corn and wheat flours, eggs, sugar and other food products so that he can respond to demand

loans.name: Celfina

texts.pt:
Celefina, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos, 2 é que frequenta escola em diferentes níveis, vive na casa própria e não sustenta a ninguém além dos seus filhos. 
É auxiliar administrativa de profissão na Escola Primária Completa de Mawandla.
Com o presente empréstimo de 10.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais sacos de cimento, pedra, areia fina e grossa para efectuar de obras de acabamento em sua casa.
Tem como sonhos melhorar as condições da sua moradia e construir um aviário para desenvolver a avicultora. Tem como principal desafio a falta de fundos para realizar seus sonhos.
texts.en:
Celefina is single and the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom go to school. She lives in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone other than her children.

She's an administrative assistant at the Mawandla Complete Primary School.

With this loan for 10,000.00 mt (MZN) she plans to buy more sacks of cement, stone and two types of sand to finish the construction work on her home.

Her dream is to improve her living conditions and build an aviary and make a start in aviculture. Her main challenge is the lack of funds to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: buy more sacks of cement, stone and two types of sand to finish the construction work on her home.

loans.name: Maria Jimena

texts.es:
Maria Jimena cuenta con pocos recursos económicos  y quiere ingresar a estudiar la  profesión de salud oral en campo alto, para darle una mejor cálida de vida a los 3 hijos que tiene, es vendedora  de cosméticos de belleza, pero desafortunadamente el sueldo es muy mínimo y no le alcanza para cubrir los gastos de mis hijos. 
El convenio que le ofrece KIVA  es una oportunidad  para poder ingresar a estudiar, esto laboralmente la va a beneficiar en un campo de mayor estabilidad laboralmente y económicamente. 
Personalmente le ayuda a crecer como persona e edificarse profesionalmente para poder prestar un buen servicio a la comunidad.
Agradece su atención prestada
texts.en:
Maria Jimena has limited financial resources. She would like to enroll for professional studies in dental health at Campo Alto to give her three children a better quality of life. She sells beauty products, but unfortunately her salary is very low and does not cover her children's expenses.

The loan which Kiva is offering her is an opportunity to begin her studies. Professionally, it will benefit her to be in a field with higher job and financial stability. Personally, this will help her to grow as a person and build her professional skills so that she can offer a good service to her community. Thank you for your attention.

loans.use: to pay for one semester of tuition fees.

loans.name: Segundo Elias

texts.es:
Segundo Elias tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en la zona urbana de Oyotun, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente cultivos de arroz, algodón, yucas, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la compra y venta de aves de corral desde hace dos años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales patos, gallinas y cerdos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Elias is 27 years old and lives with his wife and children in an urban zone of Oyotun, a community dedicated to agriculture, primarily the cultivation of rice, cotton, yucca, businesses and livestock. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayque, on the northern coast of Peru. 
Segundo Elias buys and sells birds. He has had this business for two years and it is located on the same grounds as his house. He has asked for a loan to purchase animals like ducks, chickens, and pigs in order to re-sell them to this customers and to make higher earnings for his family.

loans.use: purchase small animals like chickens, ducks and pigs.

loans.name: Natalia Andrea

texts.es:
Natalia es una mujer emprendedora y activa, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una casa arrendada. Se capacitó para ser estilista de belleza, oficio que hoy en día le brinda el sustento para ella y su familia; tiene su propia sala de belleza en la que trabaja todos los días y de manera alterna, administra un hospedaje dentro de su misma casa, aprovechando que la vivienda es grande y tiene muchas habitaciones disponibles, esto le permite solventar los gastos por arriendo y además complementa sus ingresos familiares.
El crédito que solicita se invertirá en la compra de algunas camas, realizar adecuaciones del espacio (pintar la casa), renovar algunos enseres de las habitaciones, esto le permitirá mejorar la imagen del establecimiento y podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus inquilinos, logrando aumentar los ingresos que percibe.
Natalia tiene como propósito para mediano plazo, adquirir su casa propia para poner ambos negocios en ella y así hacer de su fuente de ingresos una actividad más rentable, con la que pueda tener la capacidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Natalia is an entrepreneur and active woman; she lives with her husband and two children in a rented house. She studied to be a stylist, a profession that today gives her enough livelihoods for her and her family. She has her own beauty salon where she works every day, and at the same time she runs a lodging house in the place where she lives, taking advantage of its great size and all the rooms that it has. All of this allows her to pay the rental expenses and to help with the family income. 

The loan she is asking for will be used to buy some beds, make adaptations to the place (like painting the house), and to get new essentials for the rooms. This will allow her to improve the image of her business and to offer her tenants a better service, which will finally give her more income. 

Natalia’s medium-term plan is to acquire her own house so she can establish there both of her businesses. By doing this she hopes to make her source of income a more profitable activity with which she can improve her family living conditions.

loans.use: to buy some beds, make adaptations to the place (painting the house), and to get new essentials for the rooms.

loans.name: Vaniza

texts.en:
Vaniza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Vaniza has been in this business for two years; she earns more income from a general store.

Vaniza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is married, with seven children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has practiced farming, growing various crops such as vegetables and tomatoes. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase seeds and pesticide for her business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and pesticide for her business

loans.name: Geresomu

texts.en:
Geresomu, a married man with four school-going children, lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a primary school teacher but also started up a produce business and farming after realizing that salaries come late or don't come at all. Seasonal changes affect his income, though his dream is to build a memorable residential house for his family.

Geresomu is requesting this loan to buy maize and beans to resell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to resell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is taking a loan of USD 1,000 to improve her business. She is married and she has two children. 

Fatima is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy carrots and vegetables. She opened her kiosk in 2000, with her own working capital USD 150. 

Fatima is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy carrots and vegetables for her kiosk.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is a 24-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband, a daughter and a son in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Since 2011, her husband has operated a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business, and thus his wife, Ghazala, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods for his general store to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for a better future for his children. Ghazala and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family. She is thankful to BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for buy a variety of goods for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Lorena Evangelina

texts.es: Lorena de 49 años de edad es soltera y habita en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo. De esta forma se gana la vida honradamente y lleva el sustento a su casa. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo ya que la madera se encuentra dañada y es necesario cambiarla lo antes posible. Expresa tener la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en: Lorena is 49 years old, single, and lives in a home of her own.  She has been providing domestic services for a long time and earns an honest living and supports her household this way.  She is asking for a loan through FUSAI to repair her roof, since the wood is damaged and it needs to be replaces as soon as possible.  She says that she can repay the loan.

loans.use: to repair her roof.

loans.name: Raimundo

texts.pt:
Raimundo, casado maritalmente, pai de 4 filhos, 3 que frequentam escola em diferentes níveis, vive na casa própria e sustenta também a sua mãe que vive noutra casa. 
É docente de profissão e dedica-se também a compra de vestuário há mais de dez anos e a sua esposa apoia na actividade comercial.
Com o presente empréstimo de 15.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais mantas, camisetes, calças, saias e blusas para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonhos ver seus filhos formados profissionalmente e melhorar as condições da sua habitação. Tem como principais desafios a falta de fundos para investir nas suas obras e fraco apoio dos parentes para os seus filhos a fim de dar continuidade com os estudos.
texts.en:
Raimundo is married and the father of 4 children, 3 of whom go to school, all at different levels. He lives in his own house and also supports his mother who lives in another house.

He's a teacher by profession but for the last ten years he has also bought and sold clothing. His wife helps him with his commercial activity.

With this loan for 15,000.00 mt (MZN) he plans to buy blankets, shirts, pants, skirts and blouses in order to respond to demand and reinforce his stock.

His dream is to see his children as university graduates and improve their living conditions. His main challenges are the lack of funds to invest in the construction of his house and the lack of support from relatives in helping his children continue with their studies.

loans.use: buy blankets, shirts, pants, skirts and blouses in order to respond to demand and reinforce his stock.

loans.name: Vicencia

texts.pt:
Vicência, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos, apenas um é que vai à escola, vive na casa própria e não tem dependentes.
É comerciante há mais de dez anos e administra pessoalmente seu negócio.
Tomou 8 mil inicialmente e com o presente empréstimo de 20.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais caixas de refrescos, farinha de trigo, óleo e açúcar para aumentar o volume da mercadoria a fim de satisfazer os clientes.
Tem como sonhos construir uma casa condigna e mobiliar-a. Tem como principal desafio a falta de fundos para realizar seus sonhos.
texts.en:
Vicência is single and the mother of 3 children, only one of whom goes to school. She lives in her own house and doesn't have any other dependents.

She has been a trader for more than ten years and personally manages her business.

She initially took out a loan of 8,000.00 mt (MZN) and with this current loan of 20,000.00 mt she plans to buy more boxes of sodas, wheat flour, oil and sugar to increase the volume of her stock and satisfy customer demands.

Her dream is to build a decent house and to furnish it. Her main challenge is the lack of funds to turn her dreams into a reality.

loans.use: buy more boxes of sodas, wheat flour, oil and sugar to increase the volume of her stock and satisfy customer demands.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.pt:
Carolina, casada maritalmente e mãe de 1 filho, vive na casa própria e sustenta também seu sobrinho e irmão que estão em Maputo.
É comerciante há mais de dez anos e o seu esposo apoia na actividade comercial.
Com o presente empréstimo de 10.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais sacos de arroz, caixas de sardinha, vinhos e cigarros aumentando o stock a fim de satisfazer a demanda.
Tem como sonhos adquirir gado e uma viatura para facilitar o transporte pessoal e da mercadoria. Seus principais desafios mitigar créditos de cobrança duvidosa no negócio e a falta de fundos para investir mais no negócio.
texts.en:
Carolina is married and the mother of 1 son. She lives in a house she owns and also supports her nephew and brother who are in Maputo.

She has been a trader for more than ten years and her husband supports her in her commercial activities.

With this loan for 10,000.00 mt (MZN) she plans to buy more sacks of rice, boxes of sardines, wine and cigarettes to increase the quantity of her stock and satisfy demand.

Her dream is to buy cattle and a vehicle to facilitate both personal transportation and that of her products. Her main challenges are to mitigate the risk of bad debt in her business and the lack of funds to invest in her business.

loans.use: buy more sacks of rice, boxes of sardines, wine and cigarettes to increase the quantity of her stock and satisfy demand.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.pt:
Sérgio, casado maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos, somente é que frequenta escola, vive na casa própria sustenta também a sua mãe e sobrinho que vivem juntos. 
É Pedreiro de profissão e a sua esposa dedica-se na actividade comercial.
Com o presente empréstimo de 10.000,00mt pretende adquirir sacos de cimento, tijolos e varrões de ferro a fim melhorar sua obra.
Tem como sonhos concluir com as obras e abrir uma ferragem para venda de material de construção. Tem como principal desafio a falta de fundos para investir nas suas aspirações.
texts.en:
Sérgio is married and the father of 2 children, only one of whom goes to school. He lives in his own house and also supports his mother and nephew who live together.

He's a stonemason by profession and his wife works in retail.

With this loan of 10,000.00 mt (MZN) he plans to buy sacks of cement, bricks and iron poles to make improvements on his house.

His dream is to finish the building work and to open a hardware store to sell construction materials. His main challenge is the lack of funds to invest in his aspirations.

loans.use: buy sacks of cement, bricks and iron poles to make improvements on his house.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: Emiliana es una mujer muy emprendedora de 48 años de edad, acompañada, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es la venta de calzado y cosas de plástico desde hace 13 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 4 años, el crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de inventario como panas, vasos, baldes, panas medianas, sandalias altas, sandalias bajs, truchas variadas, baldes grandes, otros.
texts.en: Emiliana is a very entrepreneurial woman.  She is 48 years old, married, and has two children.  She has been selling shoes and plastic items for 13 years and has been with the institution for four years.  She will use the money from this loan to buy corduroys, glasses, pails, high and low sandals, “truchas,” large buckets, etc.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Liliana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Liliana tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en la zona urbana de Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, dicho distrito de se encuentra ubicado sobre el valle de Zaña, a una hora con veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de queso, quesillo, salchicha y embutidos, desde hace más de 3 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el exterior del mercado de su distrito, cuenta con clientela considerable, Liliana ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevo soles para la compra de mercadería en mayor cantidad de leche e insumos para la elaboración de sus productos lácteos y de esta manera ofrecer mayor producción de quesos y quesillos a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Liliana is 30 years old. She lives with her daughter in the urban zone of Cayalti, a community whose residents work in agriculture, commerce, and the cattle industry. This district is located in the Zaña valley, one hour and twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo n the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast.

She makes a living by selling cheese, fresh cheese patties, sausages and deli meats and has done so for more than three years. Her business is located on the outside of her district's market. She has a considerable amount of customers.

She requests a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase merchandise, like milk and supplies to make dairy products, in bulk so that she can offer a better selection of cheese and cheese patties to her customers, thereby generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make cheese and sausage.

loans.name: Yurina Group

texts.es: Francis es una de los cuatro socios que conforman el grupo tiene la edad de 23 años, casada, con dos hijos de 11,3,2 años, su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosméticos desde hace 3 años, tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de prendas laminadas bañadas en oro y plata. Juan tiene 55 años su negocio es una pulpería y un taxi, Estela mujer de 47 años su negocio es la venta de productos varios, Sorayda mujer de 33 años su negocio es la venta de productos varios.
texts.en:
Francis is one of the four members that make up this group.  She is 23 years old, married, and has three children, ages 11, 3, and 2.  She has been selling clothing and cosmetics for three years and has been a client of the institution for one year.  She is asking for a loan to buy gold and silver plated accessories.  

Juan is 55 years old and he has a general store and a taxi.

Estela is 47 years old and sells various types of merchandise.

Sorayda is 33 years old and sells various types of products.

loans.use: to buy accessories.

loans.name: Elsa Edith

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a Elsa, quien con su anterior  credikiva compró electrodomésticos, vajillas, mecedoras etc. logrando incrementar su capital de trabajo y también sus ventas. Desde que recibió su credikiva, ha tenida una mayor rentabilidad y ha aumentado su bienestar. Ella dice a sus financiadores de Kiva que “Se siente muy agradecida por el gesto, que hacen con el empresario y que el señor Dios los siga ayudando “.
En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, mediante el cual comprará ropa, calzado y electrodomésticos, para dará respuesta a sus clientes, que le han hecho sus pedidos  y esto es justamente, lo que hace que su crédito tenga éxito, porque con esta inversión, logrará  responder a los encargos de su mejor clientela, que es la que usualmente Elsa administra y hacen que su negocio se fortalezca..
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Elsa who used her previous Kiva loan to buy household appliances, tableware, cradles, etc., which allowed her to increase her working capital and sales.  Since she got her Kiva loan, she has had more responsibility and profit, and her wellbeing has improved.  “She is very grateful for the gesture that you make for this entrepreneur and hopes that the Lord will continue to help you.”

She is asking for a new loan to buy clothing, shoes, and appliances to offer her customers who have placed orders with her.  This is what will make her loan a success, because she will be able to better respond to her orders, which is what Elsa usually manages and what strengthens her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
This is Teodora, 56 and resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Francisco, a retired police officer, and a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Teodora maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her to continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 11,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Teodora hopes to buy a vehicle and dreams to have a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio, 50 years old, is a farmer in Lallo. He is married and has six children. He has been in the farming business for ten years. Income from his farming business goes toward their daily needs, allowances and revolving capital to his rice farmland.

Due to insufficient funds that he has had, he is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase seeds, pesticides and fertilizers. He hopes to obtain his requested loan amount to produce good income and definitely improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pesticides and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Deili Saray

texts.es: Deili, tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio del Progreso, Yoro, junto a sus tíos y primos.  Ella trabajo por varios años en una tienda. Lleva 6 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa, calzado y cosméticos. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 5,000 Lempiras para comprar un fardo de ropa de mujer y aumentar el inventario y las ganancias. Tiene como meta hacer crecer el negocio y crecer en clientes.
texts.en: Deili is 26 years old and a single mother with a son.  She lives in the town of Progreso, Yoro, along with her uncles and cousins.  She has worked in a store for several years, selling clothing, shoes, and cosmetics.  She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Lempiras to buy women’s clothing to increase her inventory and earnings.  Her goal is to grow her business and number of customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii is a married woman with four school going children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothing business, selling clothes for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business.

Mealii is requesting 10,000 KES to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Yulicia

texts.es:
Yulicia agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado y desea seguir participando en este proyecto pues le ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio, ella continua con la venta de verduras y frutas como por ejemplo zanahorias, tomates, cebollas, naranjas, papayas, plátanos y piñas. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas como piñas y papayas. 

Ella tiene 54 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. (La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Yulicia is grateful to the Kiva lenders for this loan, and she feels happy to be getting this support.  She wants to continue to participate in this program, as it has helped her to increase her business capital.  Yulicia is continuing with her business selling fruits and vegetables, such as: carrots, tomatoes, onions, oranges, papayas, bananas, and pineapples.  She has been a member of the communa bank "Chacoq" for a number of years, and at this time she needs a loan to buy fruits such as pineapples and papayas.

Yulicia is 54 years old, and she lives in the city of Pilcopata.  She is a hardworking and enterprising person who is getting ahead.  

(The city of Pilcopata is the capital of the Kosñipata district, in Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy fruits such as pineapples and papayas.

loans.name: Fabio Hernán

texts.es:
Fabio es un campesino del oriente antioqueño que se caracteriza por su empuje y el esmero con el que trabaja diariamente para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos de 2 y 4 años y a su amada esposa.
Actualmente se gana la vida trabajando como agricultor, pues es la actividad que aprendió de sus padres y que, hoy en día se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos. Esto lo motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para hacerle frente a un gran desafío que se le presentó en la última cosecha, pues con los fuertes cambios climáticos se dañaron sus cultivos, ocasionando pérdidas económicas.
El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, semillas, pesticidas, fertilizantes, entre otro) y realizar una ampliación de  sus cultivos, esto le permitirá aumentar su producción y estará en la capacidad para vender más productos, lo que le ayudará a recuperar su capital de trabajo para reinvertir en sus cultivos y solventar las necesidades básicas del hogar. 
Fabio manifiesta que su único propósito es seguir luchando para que sus hijos puedan disfrutar un mejor bienestar y educación para que sean personas idóneas, además quiere inculcarles desde pequeños, el amor por el campo y la agricultura, para que sigan con su legado y nunca pasen necesidades de ningún tipo.
texts.en:
Fabio is a farmer from western Antioquia who is defined by his dedication and the care that he takes every day with his work so that he can move his children, who are 2 and 4 years old, and his beloved wife forward. He currently makes a living by working as a farmer. He learned this trade from his parents and, today, it is his principal source of income. This has motivated him to seek the help of a loan, so that he can confront a big challenge that he faced during his most recent harvest. The strong changes in climate have damaged his crops, causing economic losses.

The loan will be used to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies in bulk (manure, seeds, pesticides, fertilizers, etc.) and expand his crops. This will allow him to increase his production and have the capability to sell more products, which will help him to regain his working capital to reinvest in his crops and pay for household necessities.

Fabio tells us that his only goal is to continue fighting for his children to enjoy a better lifestyle and education so that they can be suitable people. He also wants to instill in them from a young age a love for the countryside and agriculture so that they will continue with his legacy and never want for anything.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies in bulk (manure, seeds, pesticides, fertilizer, etc.) and expand his crops.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz es madre soltera de 5 hijos a los que sacó adelante con amor y mucho esfuerzo, trabajando arduas jornadas para poder brindarles alimento y educación.
Desde hace aproximadamente 13 años, se dedica a trabajar como estilista de belleza, prestando sus servicios a domicilio, no tiene un horario de trabajo establecido, pues está disponible para cuando sus clientes lo requieran; de esta forma se ha ganado la vida y logra solventar los gastos básicos del hogar.
Luz sueña con montar su sala de belleza en un local comercial y sigue trabajando arduamente para llegar a cumplir ese objetivo. Por ello, se motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará insumos e instrumentos de trabajo (tinturas, tratamientos capilares, esmaltes para uñas, cepillos, un secador y una plancha para el cabello), esto le permitirá mejorar su capacidad instalada y atender mejor a sus clientes, teniendo la disponibilidad de insumos suficientes para satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades de sus clientes. 
Para Luz, esto significaría tener mejor calidad de vida, bienestar y progreso.
texts.en:
Luz is a single mother of 5 children, whom she is moving forward with love and a lot of effort. She works difficult shifts to be able to provide food and education for them. 

About 13 years ago, she began working as a cosmetologist, providing services in her home. She does not have an established schedule; instead she is available whenever her customers need her. This is how she has earned a living and managed to pay for household expenses.

Luz dreams of opening a beauty salon and continues to work hard to achieve this goal. This has motivated her to request the support of a loan, with which she will purchase supplies and instruments for her job (dye, hair treatments, nail polish, brushes, a hair dryer, and a hair straightener). This will allow her to improve her abilities and provide better services to her customers and have sufficient supplies to satisfy her customers' diverse tastes and needs. To Luz, this means that she will have a better quality of life, well being, and progress.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for work (dye, hair treatments, nail polish, brushes, a hair dryer, and a hair straightener).

loans.name: Sumaq Causay De Acorcona Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAQ CAUSAY DE ACORCONA”; Este banco se ubicado en el sector de Acorcona  en el distrito de Vilcabamba y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Paulina ella es conviviente y tiene 46 años; La socia altera sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura ,a la cosecha de café y  plátanos entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, abono para su chacra.
Los otros socios se dedican a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Sumaq Causay de Acorcona” Communal Bank. This bank is located in the Acorcona sector of Vilcabamba district in the Department of Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                            

Paulina, a member, is 46 years old and married. She spends her days dedicated to agricultural activities,  including her coffee and plantain crops among others. Paulina has been involved in this business for a good while, and it is going well thanks to the daily effort she puts into her business. Paulina is a responsible and enterprising person, and for this reason she is advancing her family. She wishes to continue working so that she can continue helping her family.

Paulina is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and manure for her farm.

The other bank members are dedicated to agriculture and to raising small farm animals.

Paulina is grateful to all those who invest and become a part of her dream, and she promises to comply with all her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for a farm.

loans.name: Herminia Doris

texts.es:
Doris agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado y desea seguir participando en este proyecto pues le ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio, ella continua con la venta de madera. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera. 

Ella tiene 44 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. (La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Doris is 44 years old and lives in the city of Pilcopata. This city is the capital of the district of Kosñipata in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco in Peru.  

She is a hardworking and enterprising person who is making economic progress.  She wishes to thank her investors for her first loan, and she is grateful for the support.  She wishes to continue to make use of these loans since they help her to stock her business.  She is continuing to sell wood.  For several years she has been a member of the communal bank "Chacoq".  She is currently in need of a loan in order to purchase wood.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado y desea seguir participando en este proyecto pues le ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio, ella continua con el negocio de  brindar servicio de hospedaje. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del hospedaje o sea va comprar  toallas y jaboncillos.  

Ella tiene 46 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. (La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Doris is 46 years old and lives in the city of Pilcopata. This city is the capital of the district of Kosñipata in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco in Peru.

She is a hardworking and enterprising person who is making economic progress. She wishes to thank her investors for her first loan, and she is grateful for the support. She wishes to continue to make use of these loans since they help her to operate her business. She is continuing to run her own hotel. For several years she has been a member of the communal bank "Chacoq". She is currently in need of a loan in order to perform maintenance on her hotels and to purchase towels and soaps.

loans.use: to buy towels and soaps.

loans.name: Mosoq Allpa Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOSOQ ALLPA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gina ella es conviviente , tiene 34 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia altera sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas,perfumes,colonias entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia  a su negocio, la socia vende sus productos a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades,clientes,familiares entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar perfumes y colonias para damas.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de productos por catalogo, tienda de abarrotes, venta de cosméticos, elaboración y venta de refrigerios, trabajadores de empresas privadas.

La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These women belong to the "Mosoq Allpa" communal bank. This group is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

Gina is married, is 34 years old, and has one son. She alternates her daily activities with selling beauty products like cream, perfume, cologne, etc. She has been working in this business for a good amount of time. It is going well, thanks to the effort that she puts forth every day for her business. She sells her products to customers like friends, clients, family members, and other people. She would like to continue working so that she can continue to support her family. She requests this loan to purchase women's perfume and cologne.

The other members of the group make a living by selling products from catalogs, running small grocery stores, selling cosmetics, making and selling snacks, and working for private companies.

The member who appears in the bottom left of this photo requested permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work conflicts.

Gina thanks everyone who is a part of this dream in this way, and promises to make her payments at the scheduled time.

loans.use: to purchase women's perfume and cologne.

loans.name: Rosa Erika

texts.es:
Rosa agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado y desea seguir participando en este proyecto pues le ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio, ella continua con la venta de madera. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera. 

Ella tiene 29 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. (La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Rosa thanks donors for the loan and is happy with the help that she has received. She wishes to continue participating in the project as it has helped her with her business selling wood. For several years now she has belonged to the Chacoq Community Bank and is currently seeking a loan to buy more wood.

Rosa is 29 years old and lives in the town of Pilcopata. She is hardworking and enterprising and wishes to get ahead in life. (The town of Pilcopata is the capital of Kosñipata district, Paucartambo province, Cusco department, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Multicolor Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman cuatro socias una de ellas es Estela mujer de 42 años, casada, con dos hijos de 20 y 13 años, su negocio es la venta de ropa y calzado desde hace 8 años. Solicita el crédito para la compra de ropa pantalones, shores, blusas, camisas, zapatos de todo estilo y pólvora para la época de navidad. Lisbeth tiene 32 años su negocio es la venta de variedades, Aura mujer de 35 años se dedica a la venta de productos varios y Geissel mujer de 32 años su negocio es la venta de sandalia, ropa interior.
texts.en:
This group is made up of four members.  One of them is Estela.  She is 42 years old, married, and has two children, ages 20 and 13, and has been selling clothing and shoes for eight years.  She is asking for a loan to buy clothing, pants, shorts, shirts, blouses, shoes of all styles, and fireworks for the Christmas season.

Lisbeth is 32 years old and sells a variety of merchandise.

Aura is 35 years old and sells various types of products.

Geissel is 32 years old and sells sandals and undergarments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rayito De Arcoiris Group

texts.es: Este grupo lo forman tres mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras una de ellas Deyling tiene la edad de 22 años, soltera, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y ropa en su comunidad desde hace 1año. Tiene un hijo de 14 meses. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisas, shores, trajes de niños, perfumes, lociones, cremas, maquillaje, bodys, otros. María José tiene la edad de 28 años su negocio es una pulpería y Zurama mujer de 32 años su negocio es la venta de tortillas y nacatamales.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three very hardworking women.  Deyling is one of them, is 22 years old, single, and has been selling cosmetics and clothing in her community for a year.  She has a 14 month old son.  She needs this loan to buy pants, blouses, shorts, children’s outfits, perfumes, lotions, creams, makeup, and other things.

Maria Jose is 28 and has a store.

Zurama is 32 and sells tortillas and nacatamales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Unión Progresista  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Unión Progresista está formado por 13 mujeres, viven por la parroquia de Santa Ana en Cuenca, lugar de clima frió y verdes campos, desde su centro se puede admirar la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es amable y gentil que gozan de un gran carisma, aún mantienen la cultura y tradiciones que sus padres les han inculcado, su actividad económica es en especial la crianza de animales y la agricultura. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ruth, se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Unión Progresista, le gusta esta forma de crédito porque todas son amigas y siempre están compartiendo gratos momentos en las reuniones.
La Señora. Ruth tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 4 años que está en una escuelita de la localidad, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su madre con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
Doña Ruth labora de lunes a viernes como empleada doméstica, en su casa se dedica a la cría de gallinas y cuyes, también cultiva y su cosecha es para su casa y si existe un sobrante lo vende. 
El dinero de su crédito es para comprar pollos para crecer en este negocio. Su meta es aumentar la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
The "Union Progresista" group is made up of 13 women. They live in the Santa Ana parish in Cuenca, where there is a cold climate and green fields. From its center, you can admire the city of Cuenca. The people are friendly, kind, and very charismatic. They still follow the culture and traditions that their parents passed on to them. Their main economic activities are raising animals and farming.

One of the members is Ruth. She is on her third loan with her friends and members of the Union Progresista group. She likes this group because all of the members are friends and they always share pleasant moments at their meetings. Ruth is 23 years old and is the single mother of a 4-year-old daughter who attends a local school. She doesn't have her own home, so she lives with her mother and shares the household expenses.

Ruth works from Monday to Friday as a domestic worker. At home, she raises chickens and guinea pigs. She also farms and her harvest is for her family but, if there is enough, she sells it. The money from this loan is to purchase chickens to raise in this business. Her goal is to increase the number of animals that she raises.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida is a married woman and a mother of four children from Getafe, Bohol.  She is engaged in a retail business selling eggs, chorizo and other processed foods. She has been in business for several years now. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more eggs and chorizo, and to pay for her water supply. 

She hopes that with the additional inventory, she can sell more and increase her profitability. 

Bienvenida hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more eggs and chorizo, and to pay for her water supply

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is 57 years old, married, and has eight children. Avelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional stock of good to sell, including canned goods, dried fish, snack foods, biscuits, candies and noodles. Avelina has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending. Avelina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of goods to sell, including canned goods, dried fish, snack foods, biscuits, candies and noodles.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma appreciates her previous loan, which improved her living standard. Her prior loan enabled her to earn a better income from her motorcycle business. She would like to apply for a loan of KES 50,000 to renovate her motorbike by painting it. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to renovate the motorbike she uses in her business by painting it.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 52 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Cecilia requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is 26 and lives with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns an electrician's shop in which he sells electrical goods and provides repair services for electrical accessories, such as ceiling fans and washing machines. He also troubleshoots the underground electrical supply. He sells electrical components as well, over his shop, including bulbs, switches and sockets. He wants to buy new inventory for his shop but does not have the amount that is needed. Therefore, Farzana applied to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan, so that her husband can buy the electrical goods he needs. Farzana thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods for resale in her husband's shop.

loans.name: Irum

texts.en: Irum is a 31-year-old, a hardworking housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, her two daughters and her son. Her husband is a security guard by profession, but his monthly income is not enough to cover the household expenses of his family. Therefore, for the past four years, while he works as  security guard, he also drives a rickshaw at night. But currently he is not able to generate any income from the rickshaw, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. Irum has applied for a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to borrow the amount needed to repair the engine. With the profit, her husband wants to buy a taxi in the future. Irum desires to provide a quality education to her all children, and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very thankful to BRAC.

loans.use: to pay to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Kisinsima Abetereine Group

texts.en: Leonard is a male Ugandan, 43, married to Angella, who has four children aged 17, 15, 10 and 5. He is a teacher and a businessman who deals in agricultural produce. He has been in this business since 2009. The main reason he started the business was to diversify his income-generating activities. He is a new client and approached Ugafode for a loan through the group to buy more produce, since the season is on. He hopes to use the profits he generates to pay back his loan. His dream is to get a good car that he can use to transport produce to city factories for more profits. His main challenges are seasonality, price fluctuations, and poor roads in the area where he transacts his businesses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural produce in the form of maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Izahura Twimukye Group

texts.en:
Charles is 45, and married with 6 children ages 10, 8, 6, 4 , 2 and 1. Four of them attend school, and he is in charge of paying school fees for them.

Charles is a farmer who grows maize, rice, and beans; he also deals in produce and charcoal to supplement his income.

Charles borrowed money through the group from Ugafode previously to invest in his business. 

Charles says he was able to expand his farming project and expects more returns this year, and now Charles wants 1,000,000 shillings to buy more produce so that he can get more returns.

His dream is to complete his commercial buildings at the trading centre, however he is challenged with limited capital and poor weather.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is applying for a loan of $600 to improve her business. 

She is married and is running a business in front of her house by selling ice, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, and sugar. She is making a good income from selling ice, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, and sugar, and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. 

She is living a town near by the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. 

She started her business a year ago with her own working capital of $100.

loans.use: To buy  ice, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, and sugar

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 54-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of eight children.

Her husband owns a clothing business; he buys fabrics from a wholesaler, and sell them to the general public. He has good reputation in the market and his current customers recommend his fabrics to the other retailers as well. Due to the new customers, the demand is increasing day by day but he does not have a sufficient amount to buy more fabrics.

Therefore, Razia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to buy more fabrics to fulfill the demand.

She is in her sixth loan cycle, and has been showing an excellent repayment behavior; she has already been taken the loan from BRAC and invested in the same business.

Her dreams are for the bright future of her children, establishment of the business, and for a better living standard for her family.

She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fabric to sell.

loans.name: Nelson Ulices

texts.es: Nelson es originario de Chinandega, soltero y padre de dos hijos. Tiene  31 años de edad. Es un joven emprendedor que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado tener su propio negocio. Inicio trabajando como despachador en una tienda llamada las tres BBB con el paso del tiempo inicio a ahorrar y logro comprar ropa y vender ambulante en municipios y comarcas negocio en el cual le iba muy bien. Nelson con su esfuerzo logro alquilar un local en el mercado de la ciudad y actualmente es el dueño. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Mochilas escolares y calzado  escolar en general.
