Su plan futuro es incrementar su negocio y obtener mejores ingresos para mantener a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nelson is originally from Chinandega, is single, and has two children. He is 31 years old. He is a young businessman who, with great effort, is able to have his own business. He began working as a delivery man in a store called "Las Tres BBB". After a while, he began to save money and purchase clothing, which he sold on foot in local areas, which went very well for him.

Nelson, with a lot of effort, was able to rent a space in the local market and now owns the space. He requests the loan to purchase backpacks and school footwear. His future plan is to increase his business and earn more money to support his children.

loans.use: to purchase backpacks and school footwear.

loans.name: Julia Mercedes

texts.es: Julia Mercedes agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado y desea seguir participando en este proyecto pues le ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio, ella continua con la venta de madera. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera, ella tiene 28 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. (La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Julia Mercedes thanks donors for the loan and is happy with the help that she has received. She wishes to continue participating in the project as it has helped her with her business selling wood. For several years now she has belonged to the Chacoq Community Bank and is currently seeking a loan to buy more wood.

Julia Mercedes is 28 years old and lives in the town of Pilcopata. She is hardworking and enterprising and wishes to get ahead in life. (The town of Pilcopata is the capital of Kosñipata district, Paucartambo province, Cusco department, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Mario Andrés

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre dinámico y emprendedor, a sus 26 años de edad se dedica a realizar estudios universitarios de ingeniería civil y, de manera alterna e independiente decidió comenzar a vender productos por catálogo, con el fin de generar recursos económicos para aportar a la economía del hogar y para pagar el semestre de la universidad; sus principales clientes  son compañeros de estudio y familiares; el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y ya lleva aproximadamente 1 año realizando la labor.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de surtido al por mayor (malteadas, multivitamínicos, cremas faciales, productos de aseo, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad de inventario para satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes y, así lograr un incremento en las ventas y en las utilidades que su labor le obsequia.
Mario, con su espíritu de superación, se proyecta hacia el futuro y por ello manifiesta que su sueño es poder continuar con su negocio, incrementando sus ingresos, con los que podrá cumplir sus sueños de ser un gran empresario y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mario is a dynamic and entrepreneurial man. At 26 years old, he is working on a degree in civil engineering and also decided to sell catalog products so that he can generate economic resources and contribute to his household while paying for university tuition. 

His main customers are classmates and family members. He learned the job through experience and he has been doing this for about 1 year. He will invest the loan by purchasing products in bulk (malted beverages, multivitamins, facial cream, hygiene products, etc.). This will allow him to have enough available inventory to meet the needs and tastes of his customers. This way, he can increase his sales and usefulness.

Mario, with his desires to overcome obstacles, looks to the future and tells us that his dream is to continue with his business, increasing his sales, and achieving his dream of becoming a great businessman and improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase products in bulk (malted beverages, multivitamins, facial cream, hygiene products, etc.)

loans.name: Brigith Beatriz

texts.es:
Brigith tiene 30 años y vive en la ciudad de Imperial, trabaja como obrera en un fundo de su ciudad y su humilde trabajo es su única fuente de ingresos para poder salir adelante,. Sobre todo porque es madre de un hijo de 6 años.

Brigith esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde habita y de esta manera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo y tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Brigith is 30 years old and live in the city of Imperial, Peru.  She works as a laborer on a farm in her area, and this humble work is her only source of income to help her get ahead.  Her biggest motivation is that she has a six-year-old son.

She is grateful to the Kiva investors, since thanks to their support she will be able to purchase construction materials in order to make repairs to her home, and thus provide her family with a better quality of life.  She will keep fighting to make her greatest dreams a reality: to have her own business and to see her son have a professional career.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Los Pioneros De Pomacanchi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS PIONEROS POMACANCHI”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Pomacanchi, perteneciente a la provincia Acomayo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cipriana ella es viuda , tiene 43 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia altera sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar alimentos y cuyes para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la crianza de animales menores, ganadería, venta de materiales de construcción, venta de cds, tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Los Pioneros Pomacanchi communal bank.  This bank is located in the Pomacanchi district in the Acomayo province of the Cusco department.

Cipriana, a member, is a widow.  She is 43 years old and has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with raising small animals like guinea pigs.  She has been in this business for a good amount of time.  It is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  She raises these animals in order to later sell them to her customers that request them.  She is a responsible and diligent person.  This is the way that she gets her family ahead.

The member is requesting the loan to buy feed and guinea pigs for her business.

The other members devote themselves to raising small animals, livestock, selling construction materials, selling CD’s, and a grocery store.

The member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means.  She pledges to make her payments during the established time-frame.

loans.use: to buy feed and guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado y desea seguir participando en este proyecto pues le ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio, ella continua con la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, conservas, gaseosas, galletas, dulces, verduras, frutas y otras cosas más.  Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de azúcar y sacos de arroz.  

Ella tiene 28 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Elizabeth thanks lenders for the loan and she is happy for the support that they provide. She wants to keep participating in this project because it has helped her increase her business' capital. She continues selling basic staples like rice, sugar, noodles, canned goods, soda, cookies, sweets, vegetables, fruit, and other things.

For various years, she has belonged to the Chacoq communal bank and, at this time, she needs the loan to purchase sacks of sugar and sacks of rice.

She is 28 years old and lives in the city of Pilcopata. She is a hardworking, enterprising woman who is moving ahead. 

The city of Pilcopata is the capital of the Kosñipata district in the Paucartambo province within the department of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 51 años de edad, actualmente vive con sus diez hijos ya que su pareja falleció, en el Departamento de Sololá.
El es un hombre trabajador que lucha por salir adelante con su familia. Actualmente se dedica a cultivar cebolla, papa y zanahoria en un terreno que tiene a pocos metros de su vivienda. Eligió esta actividad porque desde pequeño su padre le enseño esta labor,  que hasta el momento es bastante rentable en cuanto a la generación de ingresos y ganancias.
El ahora cuenta con varios años de experiencia, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para la compra de semillas de papa y cebolla para cultivarlo y luego comercializarlo en el mercado local de su comunidad.
Su mayor sueño es remodelar su vivienda con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 51 years old. He lives with his ten children in the department of Sololá, as his partner passed away. He is a hardworking man who fights to get ahead with his family. 

He grows onions, potatoes, and carrots on a plot of land located a few meters away from his home. He chose this business activity because his father taught him about this labor from a young age. It is quite profitable in terms of his income and earnings.

He now has several years of experience, so he is applying for a loan of 4,000 quetzals to buy potato and onion seeds to cultivate crops. He will later sell these at the local market in his community.

His greatest dream is to remodel his home with the goal of improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy potato and onion seeds to cultivate crops.

loans.name: Apu Marcasunay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “APU MARCASUNAY”; Este banco se encuentra  ubicado en el distrito de Lamay, perteneciente a la provincia Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gabina  ella es casada , tiene 30 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia a la vez se dedica a la venta de hortalizas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar alimentos y cuyes para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de artesania, venta de hortalizas, porteadores, obreros, agricultura, crianza de animales menores.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Apu Marcasunay communal bank.  This bank is located in the Lamay district, Calca province, Cusco department.

Gabina, a member, is married.  She is 30 years old and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of raising small animals like guinea pigs and others.  She has been in this business for a good amount of time.  It is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  She raises these animals in order to later sell them to her customers who request them.  The member also sells vegetables.  She is a responsible and diligent person.  This is the way that she gets her family ahead.

The member is requesting the loan to buy feed and guinea pigs for her business.

The other members sell handicrafts, sell vegetables, are porters, are laborers, farm, and raise small animals.

The member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means.  She pledges to make her payments during the established time-frame.

loans.use: to buy feed and guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado y desea seguir participando en este proyecto pues le ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio, ella continua con la venta y compra de madera en la ciudad de Pilcopata. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera.  
(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Florencia thanks lenders for the loan and feels happy for the support that they have provided. She would like to continue participating in this project since it has allowed her to increase her working capital.

She continues selling and purchasing lumber in the city of Pilcopata.

She has belonged to the "Chacoq" communal bank for many years and, at this time, needs a loan to purchase lumber.

The city of Pilcopata is the capital of the district of Kosñipata, within the Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Humma

texts.en:
Humma is 39 years old, and is a hard working and independent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, two sons and two daughters, all of whom are studying. Her husband is a barber, and his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. 

For two years, Humma has been running a beauty salon, and she wants to purchase some more cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon. For that reason, Humma has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. On earning a profit, first of all, she will repay the loan amount to Kiva and than she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon is too congested. She hopes that her business grows more, and she is very much thankful to both Brac and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 53 years old and is married with four children.

Cristina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store. She has previously borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Cristina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is married and has five children, two are in school and three are adults. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Bahati has operated a coconut selling business for the past six years, selling from home to her neighbours and passerby. 

With the loan that she is requesting, Bahati wants to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.pt:
Pedro, casado e pai de 1 filha que não vai a escola, sustenta 4 netos e sua mãe que vivem na mesma casa.
É avicultor a mais de 20 anos e é dono do negócio, faz o exercício da actividade numa capoeira própria em sua casa, alem disso é também electricista na Estacão Zootécnica da Chobela. 
Com o presente empréstimo de 15.000,00mt pretende comprar pintos, rações e vitaminas de modo aumentar o volume da mercadoria.
Tem como sonhos construir uma casa condigna e melhor sua capoeira. Tem como principais desafios angariar fundos para investir em suas aspirações a longo prazo.
texts.en:
Pedro is married and has one daughter who is not in school. He also supports four grandchildren and his mother, who live with him.
He has been raising poultry for more than 20 years and has his own business. He keeps the birds in a coop at his house and is also an electrician at the livestock-rearing station in Chobela. 
He plans to use the current loan of 15,000 mt to buy chickens, feed, and vitamins to increase the number of birds he sells.
His dream is to build a decent house and improve his chicken coop. His main challenge is to raise enough money to invest in his long-term aspirations.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, and vitamins to increase the number of birds he sells.

loans.name: Lesbia Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña lesbia, se apoya con su pareja quien labora como cadete de taxi, mientras ella se dedica a su labor vendiendo ropa y calzado en su casa de habitación, por encargo y ambulante, procreo 3 hijos de los cuales mantiene a uno de 14 años de edad y lo apoya en su educación, los demás son mayores de edad e independientes. Doña Lesbia solicita el apoyo de crédito para hacer instalación de servicios higiénicos y  tuberías en el patio de su  casa, con el préstamo poder comprar los materiales como cemento, bloques, arena, inodoro y tubos, espera con ansias hacer esta mejora en su hogar, ya que lo que utilizan en la actualidad es una letrina el cual es muy antihigiénico para la salud familiar.
texts.en: Lesbia's life partner is a taxi driver and helps her out. She sells clothing and shoes in her house and as a street vendor. She has three children, one of whom is 14. She pays for this child's education, while the other two are independent adults. Lesbia has applied for a loan to install a sanitation system and pipes in the patio of her house. She will be able to buy materials like cement, blocks, iron, sand, a toilet, and pipes with the loan. She very much hopes to do this improvement because they are now using a latrine, which is not healthy for her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, iron, sand, a toilet, and pipes.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Vizcochoni Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Vizcochoni” en la comunidad de Vizcochoni. Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios  se dedican a la agricultura, a la venta de comida, a la venta de comestibles, al engorde de ganado, a la elaboración de artesanía, a la ganadería, a la crianza de animales menores y otros. 

Dominga tiene 46 años de edad y es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia, ella vive en la comunidad de Vizcochoni a 20 minutos de la capital del distrito de Huancarani, ella se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de animales menores y ganaderia, ella desde hace varios años que participa en el banco comunal y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono.

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.(Las personas que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografia pidieron permiso para no estar en la reunion y tuvimos que buscarles en sus domicilios). 

(La comunidad de Vizcochoni está ubicado en el del distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
A group of friends and neighbors formed the “Virgen del Carmen de Vizcochoni” communal bank in the Vizcochoni community.  This communal bank is made up of various persons who constantly search for opportunities to get ahead and provide a better future to their children through their daily efforts.  The members are farmers, sell food and prepared food, raise livestock, make arts and crafts, raise small animals, and other things.

Dominga is 46 years old and is a responsible, friendly person who gets her family ahead.  She’s from Vizcochoni, 20 minutes from the capital of the Huancarani district.  She is a farmer, and raises small animals, and livestock.  She has been with the communal bank for several years and needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

The members are grateful for the opportunity and are committed to making their payments on time. (The people in the lower part of the photograph were not able to attend the meeting) (The Vizcochoni community is located in the Colquepata district, within the Paucartambo province, in the Cusco department of Peru.)

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rokiya

texts.en: Rokiya took part in a course called “To Get Ahead," sponsored by a women's organization, because she plans to start a new business involving animal husbandry. She lives with her family in a rural area, and thus she has a good opportunity for developing this business. Rokiya needs to money because she is married and has children. She must to provide her family with all necessary things. She will buy cattle, feeds them for some months and then sell them in a local market. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for a new business.

loans.name: Mi Banquito Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatro socias una de ellas es María Luisa tiene la edad de 43 años, casada, con tres hijos de 14, 11 y 9 años, su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 10 años, sus papas le ayudan a atender la pulpería cuando ella no está. Tiene 5 años de ser cliente de la institución. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de inventario de granos básicos como es azúcar, aceite, arroz, jabón, café, papel higiénico, gaseosa, productos lácteos, cigarros, fósforos, meneítos, recargas. Aracely tiene 40 años su negocio es el destace de cerdo en pie, María de 58 años su negocio es la costura por pedido, venta de cosméticos, Vilma mujer de 35 años su negocio es la venta de hielo al por mayor.
texts.en:
This group is made up of four members.  Maria Luisa is one of them.  She is 43 years old, married, and has three children, ages 14, 11, and 9.  She has had a store for ten years and her parents help her man it when she is not there.  She has been with the institution for five years and needs this loan to buy basic grains and sugar, cooking oil, rice, soap, coffee, bathroom tissue, soft drinks, cigarettes, matches, fried pork rinds, and cell phone recharges.

Aracely is 40 years old and she sells pigs on the hoof.

Maria is 58 and does custom sewing.

Vilma is 35 years old and she sells ice in quantity.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina offers grocery items and vegetables for sale within her village. Her husband is a farmer who grows rice crops on his farm land. Her husband's earnings from farming usually goes to her childrens' school fees.

Ludivina's goal is to earn a higher income to have savings and give her family a comfortable lifestyle. To make her goal realistic, she is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy bitter gourd, squash, eggplant, okra and grocery items to sell. She is looking forward to the development of her business to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy bitter gourd, squash, eggplant, and okra to sell.

loans.name: Dalmacia

texts.en: Dalmacia is a married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She is engaged in making furniture made of bamboo, such as cribs, chairs and tables. She has been making bamboo furniture for more than ten years. She has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy bamboo, nails and varnish. With this, she will be able to improve her output, thus allowing her to sell more. Dalmacia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, nails and varnish for furniture making.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 57 years old, married and has two adult children. Her children are married and have their own families.

Leonora is engaged in a pig raising business and also sells generic medicine within her village. 

With her determination to get ahead in life, she is requesting a loan of PHP12,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes and prays that her requested loan amount will be granted so she can earn better income, which will serve as her revolving capital to her other business which is the selling of generic medicines.

She hopes and pray that lenders will continue to provide financial services for the continuous growth of her livestock business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Due to financial crisis, Josephine aims to improve her small variety store to earn a higher income. She is 27 years old and has two school-age children. She plans to acquire more kinds of grocery items to satisfy her customers' demand, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more stock of laundry soaps, snack foods, assorted candies, canned goods, noodles, beverages and seasonings to sell. Through this loan, she believes that someday, she will make the business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of laundry soaps, snack foods, assorted candies, canned goods, noodles, beverages and seasonings to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a widow and she manages a coconut farm for a living, earning well. She has been doing this since she got married and it is her best source of income. 

She became a Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) member more than ten years ago and she was able to avail herself of loans that helped her to improve her quality of living. 

Recently, Priscilla borrowed a new loan to cover the costs of coconuts, post-harvest, and other expenses. She is hopeful of gaining more income from her farm in order to redeem her pawned house.

loans.use: to cover the costs of coconuts, post-harvest, and other expenses.

loans.name: Las Del Río  ( Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las del Rio está formado por 8 mujeres que luchan a diario para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus familias, son personas amables, gentiles que aún mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Jadan en Cuenca, esta parroquia goza de un clima frió y verde vegetación, su arquitectura es una mezcla de los antiguo y lo moderno. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Rosario,  tiene 42 años, es casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido 10 hijos, uno de ellos es casado y vive independiente, uno de sus hijos trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, uno estudia en la universidad, tres están en el colegio, tres en la escuela y su último hijo aun pasa en casa. Su esposo labora como jornalero, la casa en la que viven es propia.         
Nuestra socia desde muy joven se dedica a las tareas del campo, actividad que aprendió de sus padres y ahora es su método de vida, siendo la agricultura su fuente de ingresos ya que a más de sembrar hortalizas tiene un invernadero de tomates y le va bien por el momento, también se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes, cerdos, pollos y ganado, estas actividades le dan la oportunidad de pasar en casa al cuidado de su familia.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito porque quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio ya que la ganancia que le queda es de mucha ayuda para solventar los gastos de su familia. El dinero de este crédito va a invertir en la compra de semillas y abono para su invernadero. Su meta es que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las del Rio" (The Women of the River) is made up of 8 women who fight each day to improve their families' financial stability.  They are friendly, kind people who still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.  These women live on the outskirts of Jadan Parish in Cuenca.  The parish enjoys a cold climate and green vegetation.  The architecture is a mix of old-fashioned and modern. 
One of the members of the communal bank is señora María Rosario.  She is 42-years old, married and together with her husband had 10 children.  One of her children is married and lives on his own, another works and helps the family financially, one goes to university, three are in secondary school, three are in primary school and the youngest is still at home.  María Rosario's husband works as a day laborer.  The house they live in is their own. 
This member learned to work in the fields from her parents at a young age.  It is now her way of life.  Agriculture provides her income.  In addition to plantings vegetables, María Rosario has a greenhouse for tomatoes.  At the moment, it is working out well.  She also earns a living raising animals like guinea pigs, pigs, chickens and cattle.  Her work gives her the opportunity to be at home to take care of her family. 
María Rosario is taking out another loan because she wants to keep investing in her business.  The profit she earns is a great help in meeting her family's expenses.  The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of seeds and fertilizer for her greenhouse.  María Rosario's goal is to help her children have decent careers. 
The small photo above is of a member who couldn't be there when the group picture was taken.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bernabe Felix

texts.es:
Bernabe, tiene 57 años de edad, vive en la calidad ciudad de ICA, junto a sus 2 hijos, el es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, siempre está pendiente de aprender cosas nuevas.
Bernabe, trabaja en una distribuidora de materiales de construcción hace más de más de 2 años, trabajo el cual lo realiza con mucho empeño y responsabilidad, día  a día Bernabe se esfuerza para lograr ser el mejor vendedor de la distribuidora.
Bernabe está muy agradecido con los prestatarios KIVA, ya que el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de una refrigeradora para su hogar y así mantener sus alimentos frescos.
El sueño de Bernabe es tener su casa propia y así darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hermosa familia.
texts.en:
Bernabe, age 57, lives with his two children in the warm city of Ica.  He is a very hard-working and responsible person.  He is always eager to learn new things.

Bernabe has worked for a construction material distributor for over two years.  He does this work responsibly and with a great deal of effort.  Bernabe puts forth great effort day to day in order to manage to be the best seller at the distributorship.

Bernabe is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  He will use the money to buy a refrigerator for his home.  This way he will keep their food fresh.

Bernabe’s dream is to have his own house.  This way he will give a better quality of life to his beautiful family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 69 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa, en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y comida al paso, desde hace más de 15 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite y otros productos para su bodega y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Segundo, 69, lives with his wife in the Cayaltí district, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's north coast. The residents farm, run businesses, and raise livestock. For more than 15 years, Segundo has been selling groceries and food from his house. He has applied for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy rice, sugar, oil, and other products for his shop so that he can grow his business and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Emylou

texts.en:
This is Emylou, aged 33, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Ruel, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Emylou operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 - worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by individual pieces. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Emylou dreams to expand and have a grocery store someday. She hopes to have a beautiful future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 51 years old and is married with five children. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and works hard to provide for her family. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She has requested a loan of PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, juice, cereals, etc. to sell. Delia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Delia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, juice, cereals, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish is 25 years old and married.  She has four children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Irish is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Irish has been in pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 43 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Lorna is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

Lorna has been in pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Lorniza

texts.en:
Lorniza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy an additional piglet, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lorniza has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from food vending.

Lorniza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional piglet, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is 42 years old and is married with three children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Ma. Cecilia has been in pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Ma. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Niza

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ma. Niza works hard to support her family. She has a business raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from sewing. 

Ma. Niza is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma. Niza has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 25 years old and married with one kid.

Mary Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Grace has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load credits).

Mary Grace aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 27 years old and has a live-in partner with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Theresa is borrowing 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Theresa has been in pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 45 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Margarita is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Margarita has been raising pigs for 16 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris is married and has a business selling gravel in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now, and works hard to support her family.

Iris requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of gravel to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of gravel to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. 

She is now requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes to re-sell. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes to re-sell.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a thirty-two year-old married man with five children.  He lives in Hoima, Uganda.  Being a farmer, he used the proceeds to start up a produce business whereby he supplies to schools and other people who buy at wholesale.  He is challenged by pests since he has to store the produce for some time, plus the bad roads that make transportation of the produce to the store difficult.  His dream is to open a milling machine and start selling flour so as to improve his income.
Elias is asking for a loan to buy beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married with six school-age children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a mat weaving business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in the business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of reeds and a tin of die for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of reeds and a tin of die for her business.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is married with six children, five in school and one who is an adult. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Kache has operated a clothes-selling business for the past ten years. She sells in a shop to town-dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned that seasonality and theft are her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, bananas, oranges and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, bananas, oranges and cooking oil.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is asking for a loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business.
 
The previous loan enabled her to save money from her general store business. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and soft drinks for her business.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Hendriguita

texts.en:
Hendriguita is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin).  She is married and is 25 years old.  She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as coffee, sugar, beer, Fanta, Coca cola, Sprite, cigarettes, water and bread.  She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Hendriguita is living in a town near the school.  Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people, including students, come to buy.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, beer, Fanta, Coca cola, Sprite, cigarettes, water and bread

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima, a 40-year-old hard-working woman, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, and two sons. Both are studying, and her husband is a carpenter. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Saima is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. Saima has requested a loan from KIVA partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To pay for a sewing machine.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is 35 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using his rickshaw, which always remains in bad condition. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Bushra has contacted Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan,, so that her husband can fix his rickshaw.  He wants to maintain the engine’s piston, one wheel, and wants to pay labor costs. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers. 
Bushra is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. Bushra thanks Kiva and  field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To fix the rickshaw.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Richard is married and has nine children. His wife runs a small business. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for about thirty years. They are currently growing beans and finger millet in their farm. Richard is looking forward to keeping bees as it will be an opportunity for him to earn extra income.

This is Richard’s first loan with Honey Care. He is interested in working with Honey Care as it will help him in accessing beehives for the production of honey. He intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to start a small business. Richard’s hope for the future is to have his children educated.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADENYA, composé de femmes mariées et de veuves, ont en moyenne 49 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fala Sidibela, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de chaussures, des condiments  et des habillements.                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe BADENYA sont à leurs vingt deuxième prêts solidaires.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
La cliente MARIAM,  troisième de la droite vers la gauche est vendeuse de chaussures. Elle compte acheter 2 colis de chaussures auprès des forains à Massigui et les revendra au marché et en famille à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60.000FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice sera en partie réinvesti dans l’activité et la gestion de la famille puisqu’elle est veuve.
texts.en:
The Badenya group has married and widowed female members, who are on average 49 years of age and have five children. They all live in large traditional families in the town of Fala Sidibela, which is located in the Massigui area of Dioïla prefecture, in the region of Koulikoro (Mali's second-largest administrative region). They all know each other because they are related, or are friends or neighbors, and work selling cereals, shoes, seasonings and clothing. The women are on their 22nd group loan.

Mariam, who is pictured third from right to left, works selling shoes. She plans to buy two batches of shoes from stallholders in Massigui, which she will resell in the market and at home to both male and female customers. Mariam hopes to make an average monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested in her business and used to provide for her family, as she is a widow.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Maria Roxana

texts.es:
Maria vive en la cálida ciudad de Camaná, cada día trabaja como obrera en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de manutención de su familia. 

Maria esta agradecida con lo prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar enseres para su vivienda como ollas, platos, entre otros, ya que actualmente no cuenta con ello y de esta manera podrá ir mejorando su calidad de vida y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” comprar un terreno y construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en: Maria lives in the city of Camana and works for a farming institute in her city.  This provides her an income with which to support her family.  Maria is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to them she will be able to buy household goods such as pots, plates, and other things because she currently doesn’t have any.  In this way she will be able to improve her quality of life and work to make her greatest dream a reality and buy some land on which to build a house out of solid materials.

loans.use: to buy household goods.

loans.name: Las Gaviotas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las Gaviotas está formado por 10 socias y 1 socio quienes laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que le permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares,  todas son amables, gentiles y aún mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por la parroquia de Baños en Cuenca, esta parroquia es reconocida por sus aguas termales y por sus centros de diversión, su gastronomía que es muy variada.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Silvia, este en su segundo crédito que realiza a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Las Gaviotas, le gusta este tipo de crédito porque les ayuda a crecer en sus negocios. 
La Señora. Silvia tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 6 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo esta estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo se dedica a la instalación de piso flotante, la casa en la que viven es de un familiar. Doña Silvia pasa la mayor parte del tiempo al cuidado de sus hijos, pero para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar labora se dedica a la cría de pollos, cuyes y cerdos. 
El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para sus animales. Su meta es tener un galpón de pollos más grande.
texts.en:
Las Gaviotas communal bank comprises 10 women and one man, who work at various jobs that let them pay their household expenses. They are friendly, polite people who maintain their communities' culture and traditions. They live in Baños parish in Cuenca. The parish is known for its thermal waters, entertainment centers, and diverse foods. 

Silvia, one of the members, is in her second loan cycle with the Las Gaviotas communal bank. She likes this type of funding because it allows them to grow their businesses. Silvia is 23 and married. She has two children, ages 6 and 1, from the marriage. Her oldest child attends a small local school. Her husband installs floating flooring. They live in a relative's house. Silvia spends most of her time taking care of her children, but she raises chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs to help her husband with the household expenses. She will use the loan to buy chickens and feed. Her goal is to have a bigger chicken pen.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is married and a mother of  seven children. She and her husband have been farming seaweed for 15 years now. They farm in the town of Talibon, Bohol. Seaweed is used in making kitchen wares such as basins and others. It is also consumed as food. 
Felicidad is asking for a loan to buy more seedlings, straw, and rope. With this, they will be able to improve the productivity of their seaweed farm, thus augmenting their yield and income. In the future, Felicidad has hopes of making her business a sustainable one.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings, straw and rope

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is 65 years old. She lives in a small village in a rural area with her husband and son. She also has some grandchildren.  

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than 18 years. She sells milk at local markets. In addition, they have 1.8 hectares of agricultural land where she grows potatoes. Her husband and son help her with managing the business. However, it is hardly enough to provide food for the family. 

She wants to develop her business but she has no money to buy more cattle. This loan will help her to increase the number of cattle, and the profits will help improve the family's living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is a 31-year-old, married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two children. Ana Marie is engaged in a buy-and-sell business. She sells assorted kitchen utensils and home materials. She has been in the buy-and-sell business for five years.
 
Ana Marie is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, such as basins, containers, flashlights, lighters, kitchen utensils and slippers. In the future, Ana Marie would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as basins, containers, flashlights, lighters, kitchen utensils and slippers.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   BENKADI  est constitué de  4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 5ème prêt. Les 4 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  grains d’arachide à l’image de FANTA qui est la seule femme assise   dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 300 Kg de grains d’arachide avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
This  Benkadi group is made up of four women, all of them married, with an average age of 45 and six children. They live in traditional extended families in the neighborhood called Torakabougou in the town of Bougouni. 

They met because of ties of neighborhood, friendship and business. In order to bolster their financial capacity so as to better run their businesses, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their fifth loan. The four preceding loans were correctly reimbursed. This group of women sell peanuts, just like Fanta, who is the only woman seated in the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy 300 kg of shelled peanuts from the wholesalers in Bougouni. She makes her sales in the market and out of her home, selling retail for cash or credit to a clientele of men and women. 

Fanta expects to make a monthly average profit of 40,000 F CFA which will be invested in the business and used to reimburse the loan.

loans.use: to buy shelled peanuts

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    SABOUGNOUMA est constitué de  7 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 5ème prêt. Les 4 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de grains d’arachide à l’image de AWA qui est la 1ère femme debout   dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 150Kg de grains d’arachides  avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group called  Sabougnouma is made up of seven women, all of them married, with an average age of 41 and on average four children. They live in nuclear families in the neighborhood called Torakabougou in the town of Bougouni. 

They met through ties of neighborhood, friendship and business. To bolster their financial capacity so as to better run their businesses, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their fifth loan. The four preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed. 

This group of women sell shelled peanuts just like Awa, who is the first woman standing in the photo from left to right. With her loan, she expects to buy 150 kg of shelled peanuts from the wholesalers of Bougouni. She makes her sales in the market and out of her home, retail and for cash or credit, to a varied clientele. 

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 F CFA which will be invested in the business and used to reimburse the loan.

loans.use: to buy peanuts

loans.name: Victor Raul

texts.es:
Víctor Raúl tiene 61 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el Caserío Limón del distrito de Querocotillo, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café de la variedad Catimor, el se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años por lo que cuenta con bastante experiencia, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo y de esta manera tener una buena producción para ofrecer a sus clientes a un mayor precio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor Raúl, 61, lives with his wife in Caserío Limón in the district of Querocotillo. The community is characterized for its green forests. Its people work in agriculture, trade, and livestock. It is located two hours away from the city of Cutervo, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

Víctor Raúl makes a living in agriculture, especially coffee of the Catimor variety. He has been working in this business for ten years, so he has plenty of experience. He has applied for a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy fertilizer to maintain his crops. He will then have good production to offer his clients at a higher price, earning a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to maintain his coffee crops.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Vista Alegre una zona rural del distrito de Pimpingos, una comunidad donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, también se puede apreciar cultivo de diversas variedades de flores en los alrededores de su distrito, perteneciendo a la Provincia de Cutervo, que se encuentra en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura principalmente al cultivo de cafeto de la variedad de catimor, tiene sembrado 2 ha de su propiedad, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 5 años, también se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado vacuno, es un padre emprendedor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abono para el cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una mejor producción y cosecha para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 34 years old, and he lives with his wife and children in the village of Vista Alegre, a rural area within the district of Pimpingos. 

The people in this community work in agriculture, trade, and livestock.  Also, diverse varieties of flowers are cultivated in the areas that surround his district, which is part of the Cutervo Province within the Cajamarca Region of Peru’s northern sierra. 

He works in agriculture, and for 5 years he has mainly cultivated the Catimor variety of coffee, which he has planted on two hectares of his land. He also raises and sells cattle. 

He is a very industrious parent, and he is seeking a loan of 2,500 nuevos soles in order to purchase fertilizer for his coffee crop.  This way he will have a better production and harvest to offer his customers, thus generating more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es:
Yuri nació en un hogar muy humilde carente de muchas cosas, y con un padre poco responsable, la madre convivió con el cinco años  y luego se separó porque les daba mala vida, no las alimentaba y las maltrataba, la madre volvió a casarse y llevo a yuri con ella  a vivir con otro señor que aparentemente las quería, después de 6 largos años la convivencia se tornó molesta por las malas intenciones.
Yuri con tan solo 13 años de edad decidió hacerse cargo de la vida de ella, con el apoyo de la abuela materna, ella entonces se vio obligada a dejar los estudios en el colegio y ponerse a trabajar durante  un año, luego de ese tiempo  ingresó a estudiar validando los dos años que le faltaban (decimo y once), con el dinero que le pagaban se compró los útiles, uniformes y matricula, acordaron con el jefe que los horarios de trabajo, pero después de un tiempo el jede no le dio mas trabajo, siguió estudiando con lo poco que le podía ayudar la abuela y culminó exitosamente el bachiller.
Decidió venir a probar suerte en una ciudad más grande en el 2006, para ese tiempo ya tenía 16 años, la intención era trabajar, pero era más complicado que en la anterior ciudad, aun así,  consiguió empleo con un amigo  que tenía un local pequeño donde vendía gorras y correas; para ese entonces se conoció con el que  ahora es el esposo, los anhelos siempre fueron seguir estudiando porque ha tenido muy claro que es lo único que le ayudara a salir adelante; ingresó a un instituto estudió un semestre de secretariado y se tuvo que retirar por que resultó embarazada y el embarazo era de alto riesgo, conformo el hogar, con el padre de la niña y se  dedicó a las cosas de la casa, no podía estudiar  por cuestión de dinero, tampoco trabajaba por estar con la bebe. 
En la actualidad está estudiando gracias a Dios y al esfuerzo que están haciendo junto con la pareja, pues vivir  tres con un solo salario es complicado  pero saben que es una gran inversión para la vida, teniendo en cuenta una oferta laboral mejor remunerada y un ingreso más alto en la casa, no tienen mucho hay veces que se ven cortos para la mensualidad, por eso se vio interesada en el convenio con kiva, eso les da aliento para confiar que todo estará mejor. 
Tienen una familia muy unida, cariñosa y por la cual se esfuerzan y valoran la oportunidad de estar estudiando, disfrutan cada día que pasan junto a la hija y trata de enseñarle que hay que luchar por los sueños sin pasar por encima de los demás.
texts.en:
Yuri was born in a very humble home lacking many things, and with an irresponsible father. Her mother lived with him for 5 years, then left him because he made their lives miserable. He didn't provide food and maltreated them. Her mother married another anew, taking Yuri with her to live with another gentleman who apparently loved them. After 6 long years, however, this relationship became difficult due to bad intentions.

Yuri, at just 13 years of age, decided to take charge of her own life with the help of her maternal grandmother. She was obliged to leave her studies in school and go to work for a year. Then she enrolled to study anew, completing the 2 years she lacked (11th and 12th). She used money she earned to pay for supplies, uniforms, and tuition, and had an agreement with her boss concerning hours of work. But after a time, her boss stopped offering her work. She continued to study with what little help her grandmother could provide, managing to complete high school. 

Yuri decided to try her luck in [Bogota], the largest city in 2006. By this time she was 16 years old. Her intention was to work but this was more complicated than in the previous city. But still, she gained employment with a friend who had a small shop that sold caps and belts. Through this activity, she met the man who is now her husband. Her hopes were to continue studying because it has always been clear that this is the only thing that could help her to advance. She enrolled in an institute and studied for a semester to be a secretary. But she had to withdraw when she became pregnant and the pregnancy was at high risk. She remained at home with the father of the child and became a housewife. She could not study for the lack of money, nor could she work due to caring for the baby girl.

At present, Yuri is studying, thanks to God and her own efforts plus her husband's help. For three people to live on a single salary is complicated, but they know that it is a great investment for life, taking into account the need for a better remuneration and a higher family income. There are often times when they can't meet their monthly bills. For this reason, Yuri was interested in a loan agreement with Kiva, which gives them hope and the confidence that all will be better.

Yuri's family is very united and loving and for that reason, they make the effort and value the opportunity of studying, enjoying each passing day with their daughter and attempting to teach her that she too should struggle for her dreams without overlooking others.

loans.use: to pay fees for a semester in school.

loans.name: Sandro Evaristo

texts.es:
Sandro Evaristo tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres, en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y venta de leche, desde hace más de 10 años, es muy conocida en la zona por la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para ganado vacuno y de esta manera tener una mayor producción de leche para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Sandro Evaristo is 33 years old and lives with his parents in the District of Cayalti. His town is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This community is located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, which is on the northern coast of Peru.

Sandro has been raising cattle and selling milk for more than 10 years. He is well known in the area for the work he does. Sandro is requesting a loan of 3,000 PEN so that he can buy balanced feed for his cattle. This will result in better milk production so that he can supply his customers and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his cows.

loans.name: Fredy Alejandro

texts.es:
Fredy es un joven con muchas ganas de superarse, cada día a trabaja como mozo en una pollería de su ciudad alrededor de 9 horas al día, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos.

Fredy está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción como esteras, cañas, palos, entre otros para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda ya que es de adobe, así podrá ir mejorando su vivienda y hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en: Fredy is a young man who wants to succeed. He works about nine hours a day in a chicken store in the city. The money from this job pays his expenses. Fredy thanks the Kiva lenders, whose support will let him buy construction materials like matting, cane, poles, and other items to continue to renovate his adobe house and achieve his great dream of having his own home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 51 years old and married with four children.

Maribel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Maribel has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Maribel aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
This is Analyn, 31, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Analyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php12,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Analyn hopes to become a wholesaler and dreams to have a happy family.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell for her business.  Marivic has been in this business for eight years. Marivic earns more income from food vending also.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 54 years old, and is a widow with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Corazon has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for five years. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Corazon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Om-Obady Group

texts.en:
Om-Obady Group is a four-member group of women, from Taiz, Yemen. They have asked for a YER 260,000 group loan from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB). 

Nagla, the leader of the group, is a 39-year-old, married woman, with children. She is uneducated and doing her best to raise her children, as well as educating them. 

Her house is very old and needs some basic renovations in order to build two rooms. In the first loan, Nagla started the renovating of her house. 

In this loan, she wants to buy bricks and cement to complete the building of her two extra rooms.  She hopes that, after the completion of the building, she will feel safe in her house with her family. All group members thank Kiva lenders for financing the first loan.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement to complete building two rooms in her house.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela is 42 years old and is married with eight children. She earns a living by farming vegetables and bananas in the Philippines. Rafaela has been farming vegetables and banana for five years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Rafaela is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en:
Nadzuwa is a married woman with six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling second hand clothes for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Nadzuwa is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Sharon is 32 years old and married.  She has two children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Sharon is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her livestock.  Sharon has been raising livestock for one year and also earns additional income from a general store.  She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her livestock

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a married man with three children. He is a farmer who grows many items to feed his family, but also concentrates on coffee farming to earn income. He wants a loan to buy coffee seedlings. This being a rainy season, he has prepared a garden to plant new coffee plants, and believes that he will make a fortune out of them when they have grown. He is a hardworking and committed man. In the photo is the Ugafode credit officer and Daniel in his coffee garden.

loans.use: To buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es: Guadalupe de 21 años d edad habita junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas de 5 años y 10 meses de edad. Para ella lo más importante son sus pequeñas hijas y es por ella que junto a su compañero de vida hacen todo lo que este a su alcance para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Guadalupe es una mujer emprendedora ya que aprovecha las oportunidades del mercado para poner sus ventas y ganarse la vida honradamente. Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, helados y golosinas. De esta forma colabora con la economía de su hogar. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora de las paredes y el piso de la vivienda. Con el crédito comprará cemento, ladrillo de piso, arena y grava. Espera poder tener acceso a este financiamiento y así dar inicio al repello de las paredes y al enladrillado del piso lo antes posible.
texts.en: Guadalupe is 21 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters, ages 5 years and 10 months.  Her daughters are most important to her and she and her husband do all they can to support their household.  Guadalupe is a very enterprising woman who takes advantage of all market opportunities to make her sales and earn an honest living.  She sells soft drinks, frozen treats, and snacks.  In this way she shares in the household finances.  She decided to ask for this loan, through FUSAI, so she can repair the walls and floor in her home and improve her quality of life.  She will use the money to buy cement, floor tile, sand, and gravel.  She hopes to be able to get this loan so she can start plastering the walls and tiling her floor as soon as possible.

loans.use: to make home repairs.

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila is 42 years old. She lives in the village of Centro 2, Angadanan with her children. Precila is involved in a retail business. She has been running her business for five years and usually earns about 2,000 PHP a week. 

Precila wants to improve her business, but she lacks the necessary capital. For this reason, Precila is asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy more vegetables, condiments, eggs, and rice to sell. 

She is hoping that with her loan, she will improve her business as well as her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, condiments, eggs, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariana tiene 41 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con tres hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  

Mariana trabaja en la agricultura en la siembra maiz, arroz, cacao y maracuya a la crianza de pollos para incrementar la economía de la familia.
